00096 /** This utility routine copies the metadata (if any) attached to the
00097     'from' instruction in the IR to the 'to' instruction.  
00098 
00099     For flexibility, this function takes an llvm::Value rather than an
00100     llvm::Instruction for the 'to' parameter; at some places in the code
00101     below, we sometimes use a llvm::Value to start out storing a value and
00102     then later store instructions.  If a llvm::Value is passed to this, the
00103     routine just returns without doing anything; if it is in fact an
00104     LLVM::Instruction, then the metadata can be copied to it.
00105  */
00106 static void
00107 lCopyMetadata(llvm::Value *vto, const llvm::Instruction *from) {
00108     llvm::Instruction *to = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::Instruction>(vto);
00109     if (!to) 
00110         return;
00111                                                               
00112     llvm::SmallVector<std::pair<unsigned int, llvm::MDNode *>, 8> metadata;
00113     from->getAllMetadata(metadata);
00114     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < metadata.size(); ++i)
00115         to->setMetadata(metadata[i].first, metadata[i].second);
00116 }
00117 
00118 
00119 /** We have a protocol with the front-end LLVM IR code generation process
00120     that allows us to encode the source file position that corresponds with
00121     instructions.  (For example, this allows us to issue performance
00122     warnings related to things like scatter and gather after optimization
00123     has been performed, so that we aren't warning about scatters and
00124     gathers that have been improved to stores and loads by optimization
00125     passes.)  Note that this is slightly redundant with the source file
00126     position encoding generated for debugging symbols, though we don't
00127     always generate debugging information but we do always generate this
00128     position data.
00129 
00130     This function finds the SourcePos that the metadata in the instruction
00131     (if present) corresponds to.  See the implementation of
00132     FunctionEmitContext::addGSMetadata(), which encodes the source position during
00133     code generation.
00134 
00135     @param inst   Instruction to try to find the source position of
00136     @param pos    Output variable in which to store the position
00137     @returns      True if source file position metadata was present and *pos
00138                   has been set.  False otherwise.
00139 */
00140 static bool
00141 lGetSourcePosFromMetadata(const llvm::Instruction *inst, SourcePos *pos) {
00142     llvm::MDNode *filename = inst->getMetadata("filename");
00143     llvm::MDNode *line = inst->getMetadata("line");
00144     llvm::MDNode *column = inst->getMetadata("column");
00145     if (!filename || !line || !column)
00146         return false;
00147 
00148     // All of these asserts are things that FunctionEmitContext::addGSMetadata() is
00149     // expected to have done in its operation
00150     assert(filename->getNumOperands() == 1 && line->getNumOperands() == 1);
00151     llvm::MDString *str = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::MDString>(filename->getOperand(0));
00152     assert(str);
00153     llvm::ConstantInt *lnum = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ConstantInt>(line->getOperand(0));
00154     assert(lnum);
00155     llvm::ConstantInt *colnum = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ConstantInt>(column->getOperand(0));
00156     assert(column);
00157 
00158     *pos = SourcePos(str->getString().data(), (int)lnum->getZExtValue(),
00159                    (int)colnum->getZExtValue());
00160     return true;
00161 }

00164 /** Utility routine that prints out the LLVM IR for everything in the
00165     module.  (Used for debugging).
00166  */
00167 static void
00168 lPrintModuleCode(llvm::Module *module) {
00169     llvm::PassManager ppm;
00170     ppm.add(llvm::createPrintModulePass(&llvm::outs()));
00171     ppm.run(*module);
00172 }

00175 void
00176 Optimize(llvm::Module *module, int optLevel) {
00177     if (g->debugPrint) {
00178         printf("*** Code going into optimization ***\n");
00179         lPrintModuleCode(module);
00180     }
00181 
00182     llvm::PassManager optPM;
00183     llvm::FunctionPassManager funcPM(module);
00184 
00185     llvm::TargetLibraryInfo *targetLibraryInfo =
00186         new llvm::TargetLibraryInfo(llvm::Triple(module->getTargetTriple()));
00187     optPM.add(targetLibraryInfo);
00188     optPM.add(new llvm::TargetData(module));
00189 
00190 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0svn)
00191     optPM.add(llvm::createIndVarSimplifyPass());
00192 #endif
00193 
00194     if (optLevel == 0) {
00195         // This is more or less the minimum set of optimizations that we
00196         // need to do to generate code that will actually run.  (We can't
00197         // run absolutely no optimizations, since the front-end needs us to
00198         // take the various __pseudo_* functions it has emitted and turn
00199         // them into something that can actually execute.
00200         optPM.add(llvm::createPromoteMemoryToRegisterPass());
00201         optPM.add(CreateGatherScatterFlattenPass());
00202         optPM.add(CreateLowerGatherScatterPass());
00203         optPM.add(CreateLowerMaskedStorePass());
00204         optPM.add(CreateIsCompileTimeConstantPass(true));
00205         optPM.add(llvm::createFunctionInliningPass());
00206         optPM.add(CreateMakeInternalFuncsStaticPass());
00207         optPM.add(llvm::createGlobalDCEPass());
00208     }
00209     else {
00210         // Otherwise throw the kitchen sink of optimizations at the code.
00211         // This is almost certainly overkill and likely could be reduced,
00212         // but on the other hand trying to remove some of these has
00213         // historically caused performance slowdowns.  Benchmark carefully
00214         // if changing these around.
00215         //
00216         // Note in particular that a number of the ispc optimization
00217         // passes are run repeatedly along the way; they often can kick in
00218         // only later in the optimization process as things like constant
00219         // propagation have done their thing, and then when they do kick
00220         // in, they can often open up new opportunities for optimization...
00221         llvm::PassRegistry *registry = llvm::PassRegistry::getPassRegistry();
00222         llvm::initializeCore(*registry);
00223         llvm::initializeScalarOpts(*registry);
00224         llvm::initializeIPO(*registry);
00225         llvm::initializeAnalysis(*registry);
00226         llvm::initializeIPA(*registry);
00227         llvm::initializeTransformUtils(*registry);
00228         llvm::initializeInstCombine(*registry);
00229         llvm::initializeInstrumentation(*registry);
00230         llvm::initializeTarget(*registry);
00231 
00232         // Early optimizations to try to reduce the total amount of code to
00233         // work with if we can
00234         optPM.add(CreateGatherScatterFlattenPass());
00235         optPM.add(llvm::createReassociatePass());
00236         optPM.add(llvm::createConstantPropagationPass());
00237 
00238         if (!g->opt.disableMaskedStoreOptimizations) {
00239             optPM.add(CreateIntrinsicsOptPass());
00240             optPM.add(CreateMaskedStoreOptPass());
00241         }
00242         optPM.add(llvm::createDeadInstEliminationPass());
00243 
00244         optPM.add(llvm::createConstantPropagationPass());
00245         optPM.add(llvm::createDeadInstEliminationPass());
00246         
00247         // On to more serious optimizations
00248         optPM.add(llvm::createCFGSimplificationPass());
00249         optPM.add(llvm::createScalarReplAggregatesPass());
00250         optPM.add(llvm::createInstructionCombiningPass());
00251         optPM.add(llvm::createCFGSimplificationPass());
00252         optPM.add(llvm::createPromoteMemoryToRegisterPass());
00253         optPM.add(llvm::createGlobalOptimizerPass());
00254         optPM.add(llvm::createReassociatePass());
00255         optPM.add(llvm::createIPConstantPropagationPass());
00256         optPM.add(llvm::createDeadArgEliminationPass());
00257         optPM.add(llvm::createInstructionCombiningPass());
00258         optPM.add(llvm::createCFGSimplificationPass());
00259         optPM.add(llvm::createPruneEHPass());
00260         optPM.add(llvm::createFunctionAttrsPass());
00261         optPM.add(llvm::createFunctionInliningPass());
00262         optPM.add(llvm::createConstantPropagationPass());
00263         optPM.add(llvm::createDeadInstEliminationPass());
00264         optPM.add(llvm::createCFGSimplificationPass());
00265 
00266         optPM.add(llvm::createArgumentPromotionPass());
00267         optPM.add(llvm::createSimplifyLibCallsPass());
00268         optPM.add(llvm::createInstructionCombiningPass());
00269         optPM.add(llvm::createJumpThreadingPass());
00270         optPM.add(llvm::createCFGSimplificationPass());
00271         optPM.add(llvm::createScalarReplAggregatesPass());
00272         optPM.add(llvm::createInstructionCombiningPass());
00273         optPM.add(llvm::createTailCallEliminationPass());
00274 
00275         if (!g->opt.disableMaskedStoreOptimizations) {
00276             optPM.add(CreateIntrinsicsOptPass());
00277             optPM.add(CreateMaskedStoreOptPass());
00278         }
00279         optPM.add(CreateLowerMaskedStorePass());
00280         if (!g->opt.disableGatherScatterOptimizations)
00281             optPM.add(CreateGatherScatterImprovementsPass());
00282         optPM.add(CreateLowerMaskedStorePass());
00283         optPM.add(CreateLowerGatherScatterPass());
00284         optPM.add(llvm::createFunctionInliningPass());
00285         optPM.add(llvm::createConstantPropagationPass());
00286         optPM.add(CreateIntrinsicsOptPass());
00287 
00288 #if defined(LLVM_2_9)
00289         llvm::createStandardModulePasses(&optPM, 3, 
00290                                          false /* opt size */,
00291                                          true /* unit at a time */, 
00292                                          g->opt.unrollLoops,
00293                                          true /* simplify lib calls */,
00294                                          false /* may have exceptions */,
00295                                          llvm::createFunctionInliningPass());
00296         llvm::createStandardLTOPasses(&optPM, true /* internalize pass */,
00297                                       true /* inline once again */,
00298                                       false /* verify after each pass */);
00299         llvm::createStandardFunctionPasses(&optPM, 3);
00300 
00301         optPM.add(CreateIsCompileTimeConstantPass(true));
00302         optPM.add(CreateIntrinsicsOptPass());
00303 
00304         llvm::createStandardModulePasses(&optPM, 3, 
00305                                          false /* opt size */,
00306                                          true /* unit at a time */, 
00307                                          g->opt.unrollLoops,
00308                                          true /* simplify lib calls */,
00309                                          false /* may have exceptions */,
00310                                          llvm::createFunctionInliningPass());
00311 
00312 #else
00313         llvm::PassManagerBuilder builder;
00314         builder.OptLevel = 3;
00315         builder.Inliner = llvm::createFunctionInliningPass();
00316         if (g->opt.unrollLoops == false)
00317             builder.DisableUnrollLoops = true;
00318         builder.populateFunctionPassManager(funcPM);
00319         builder.populateModulePassManager(optPM);
00320         optPM.add(CreateIsCompileTimeConstantPass(true));
00321         optPM.add(CreateIntrinsicsOptPass());
00322         builder.populateLTOPassManager(optPM, true /* internalize */,
00323                                        true /* inline once again */);
00324         optPM.add(CreateIsCompileTimeConstantPass(true));
00325         optPM.add(CreateIntrinsicsOptPass());
00326         builder.populateModulePassManager(optPM);
00327 #endif
00328         optPM.add(CreateMakeInternalFuncsStaticPass());
00329         optPM.add(llvm::createGlobalDCEPass());
00330     }
00331 
00332     // Finish up by making sure we didn't mess anything up in the IR along
00333     // the way.
00334     optPM.add(llvm::createVerifierPass());
00335     
00336     for (llvm::Module::iterator fiter = module->begin(); fiter != module->end();
00337          ++fiter)
00338         funcPM.run(*fiter);
00339 
00340     optPM.run(*module);
00341 
00342     if (g->debugPrint) {
00343         printf("\n*****\nFINAL OUTPUT\n*****\n");
00344         lPrintModuleCode(module);
00345     }
00346 }

00350 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00351 // IntrinsicsOpt
00352 
00353 /** This is a relatively simple optimization pass that does a few small
00354     optimizations that LLVM's x86 optimizer doesn't currently handle.
00355     (Specifically, MOVMSK of a constant can be replaced with the
00356     corresponding constant value, BLENDVPS and AVX masked load/store with
00357     either an 'all on' or 'all off' masks can be replaced with simpler
00358     operations.
00359 
00360     @todo The better thing to do would be to submit a patch to LLVM to get
00361     these; they're presumably pretty simple patterns to match.  
00362 */
00363 class IntrinsicsOpt : public llvm::BasicBlockPass {
00364 public:
00365     IntrinsicsOpt();
00366 
00367     const char *getPassName() const { return "Intrinsics Cleanup Optimization"; }
00368     bool runOnBasicBlock(llvm::BasicBlock &BB);
00369 
00370     static char ID;
00371 
00372 private:
00373     struct MaskInstruction {
00374         MaskInstruction(llvm::Function *f) { function = f; }
00375         llvm::Function *function;
00376     };
00377     std::vector<MaskInstruction> maskInstructions;
00378 
00379     /** Structure that records everything we need to know about a blend
00380         instruction for this optimization pass.
00381      */
00382     struct BlendInstruction {
00383         BlendInstruction(llvm::Function *f, int ao, int o0, int o1, int of)
00384             : function(f), allOnMask(ao), op0(o0), op1(o1), opFactor(of) { }
00385         /** Function pointer for the blend instruction */ 
00386         llvm::Function *function;
00387         /** Mask value for an "all on" mask for this instruction */
00388         int allOnMask;
00389         /** The operand number in the llvm CallInst corresponds to the
00390             first operand to blend with. */
00391         int op0;
00392         /** The operand number in the CallInst corresponding to the second
00393             operand to blend with. */
00394         int op1;
00395         /** The operand in the call inst where the blending factor is
00396             found. */
00397         int opFactor;
00398     };
00399     std::vector<BlendInstruction> blendInstructions;
00400 
00401     bool matchesMaskInstruction(llvm::Function *function);
00402     BlendInstruction *matchingBlendInstruction(llvm::Function *function);
00403 };
00404 
00405 char IntrinsicsOpt::ID = 0;
00406 llvm::RegisterPass<IntrinsicsOpt> sse("sse-constants", "Intrinsics Cleanup Pass");
00407 
00408 
00409 IntrinsicsOpt::IntrinsicsOpt() 
00410     : BasicBlockPass(ID) {
00411 
00412     // All of the mask instructions we may encounter.  Note that even if
00413     // compiling for AVX, we may still encounter the regular 4-wide SSE
00414     // MOVMSK instruction.
00415     llvm::Function *sseMovmsk = 
00416         llvm::Intrinsic::getDeclaration(m->module, llvm::Intrinsic::x86_sse_movmsk_ps);
00417     maskInstructions.push_back(sseMovmsk);
00418     maskInstructions.push_back(m->module->getFunction("__movmsk"));
00419 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0svn)
00420     llvm::Function *avxMovmsk = 
00421         llvm::Intrinsic::getDeclaration(m->module, llvm::Intrinsic::x86_avx_movmsk_ps_256);
00422     assert(avxMovmsk != NULL);
00423     maskInstructions.push_back(avxMovmsk);
00424 #endif
00425 
00426     // And all of the blend instructions
00427     blendInstructions.push_back(BlendInstruction(
00428         llvm::Intrinsic::getDeclaration(m->module, llvm::Intrinsic::x86_sse41_blendvps),
00429         0xf, 0, 1, 2));
00430 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0svn)
00431     blendInstructions.push_back(BlendInstruction(
00432         llvm::Intrinsic::getDeclaration(m->module, llvm::Intrinsic::x86_avx_blendv_ps_256),
00433         0xff, 0, 1, 2));
00434 #endif
00435 }
00436 
00437 
00438 /** Given an llvm::Value represinting a vector mask, see if the value is a
00439     constant.  If so, return the integer mask found by taking the high bits
00440     of the mask values in turn and concatenating them into a single integer.
00441     In other words, given the 4-wide mask: < 0xffffffff, 0, 0, 0xffffffff >, 
00442     we have 0b1001 = 9.
00443 
00444     @todo This will break if we ever do 32-wide compilation, in which case
00445     it don't be possible to distinguish between -1 for "don't know" and
00446     "known and all bits on".
00447  */
00448 static int
00449 lGetMask(llvm::Value *factor) {
00450     llvm::ConstantVector *cv = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ConstantVector>(factor);
00451     if (cv) {
00452         int mask = 0;
00453         llvm::SmallVector<llvm::Constant *, ISPC_MAX_NVEC> elements;
00454         cv->getVectorElements(elements);
00455 
00456         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < elements.size(); ++i) {
00457             llvm::APInt intMaskValue;
00458             // SSE has the "interesting" approach of encoding blending
00459             // masks as <n x float>.
00460             llvm::ConstantFP *cf = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ConstantFP>(elements[i]);
00461             if (cf) {
00462                 llvm::APFloat apf = cf->getValueAPF();
00463                 intMaskValue = apf.bitcastToAPInt();
00464             }
00465             else {
00466                 // Otherwise get it as an int
00467                 llvm::ConstantInt *ci = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ConstantInt>(elements[i]);
00468                 assert(ci != NULL);  // vs return -1 if NULL?
00469                 intMaskValue = ci->getValue();
00470             }
00471             // Is the high-bit set?  If so, OR in the appropriate bit in
00472             // the result mask
00473             if (intMaskValue.countLeadingOnes() > 0)
00474                 mask |= (1 << i);
00475         }
00476         return mask;
00477     }
00478     else if (llvm::isa<llvm::ConstantAggregateZero>(factor))
00479         return 0;
00480     else {
00481 #if 0
00482         llvm::ConstantExpr *ce = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ConstantExpr>(factor);
00483         if (ce != NULL) {
00484             llvm::TargetMachine *targetMachine = g->target.GetTargetMachine();
00485             const llvm::TargetData *td = targetMachine->getTargetData();
00486             llvm::Constant *c = llvm::ConstantFoldConstantExpression(ce, td);
00487             c->dump();
00488             factor = c;
00489         }
00490         // else we should be able to handle it above...
00491         assert(!llvm::isa<llvm::Constant>(factor));
00492 #endif
00493         return -1;
00494     }
00495 }
00496 
00497 
00498 /** Given an llvm::Value, return true if we can determine that it's an
00499     undefined value.  This only makes a weak attempt at chasing this down,
00500     only detecting flat-out undef values, and bitcasts of undef values.
00501 
00502     @todo Is it worth working harder to find more of these?  It starts to
00503     get tricky, since having an undef operand doesn't necessarily mean that
00504     the result will be undefined.  (And for that matter, is there an LLVM
00505     call that will do this for us?)
00506  */
00507 static bool
00508 lIsUndef(llvm::Value *value) {
00509     if (llvm::isa<llvm::UndefValue>(value))
00510         return true;
00511 
00512     llvm::BitCastInst *bci = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::BitCastInst>(value);
00513     if (bci)
00514         return lIsUndef(bci->getOperand(0));
00515 
00516     return false;
00517 }
00518 
00519 
00520 bool
00521 IntrinsicsOpt::runOnBasicBlock(llvm::BasicBlock &bb) {
00522 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0svn)
00523     llvm::Function *avxMaskedLoad32 = 
00524         llvm::Intrinsic::getDeclaration(m->module, llvm::Intrinsic::x86_avx_maskload_ps_256);
00525     llvm::Function *avxMaskedLoad64 = 
00526         llvm::Intrinsic::getDeclaration(m->module, llvm::Intrinsic::x86_avx_maskload_pd_256);
00527     llvm::Function *avxMaskedStore32 = 
00528         llvm::Intrinsic::getDeclaration(m->module, llvm::Intrinsic::x86_avx_maskstore_ps_256);
00529     llvm::Function *avxMaskedStore64 = 
00530         llvm::Intrinsic::getDeclaration(m->module, llvm::Intrinsic::x86_avx_maskstore_pd_256);
00531     assert(avxMaskedLoad32 != NULL && avxMaskedStore32 != NULL);
00532     assert(avxMaskedLoad64 != NULL && avxMaskedStore64 != NULL);
00533 #endif
00534 
00535     bool modifiedAny = false;
00536  restart:
00537     for (llvm::BasicBlock::iterator iter = bb.begin(), e = bb.end(); iter != e; ++iter) {
00538         llvm::CallInst *callInst = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::CallInst>(&*iter);
00539         if (!callInst)
00540             continue;
00541 
00542         BlendInstruction *blend = matchingBlendInstruction(callInst->getCalledFunction());
00543         if (blend != NULL) {
00544             llvm::Value *v[2] = { callInst->getArgOperand(blend->op0), 
00545                                   callInst->getArgOperand(blend->op1) };
00546             llvm::Value *factor = callInst->getArgOperand(blend->opFactor);
00547 
00548             // If the values are the same, then no need to blend..
00549             if (v[0] == v[1]) {
00550                 llvm::ReplaceInstWithValue(iter->getParent()->getInstList(), 
00551                                            iter, v[0]);
00552                 modifiedAny = true;
00553                 goto restart;
00554             }
00555 
00556             // If one of the two is undefined, we're allowed to replace
00557             // with the value of the other.  (In other words, the only
00558             // valid case is that the blend factor ends up having a value
00559             // that only selects from the defined one of the two operands,
00560             // otherwise the result is undefined and any value is fine,
00561             // ergo the defined one is an acceptable result.)
00562             if (lIsUndef(v[0])) {
00563                 llvm::ReplaceInstWithValue(iter->getParent()->getInstList(), 
00564                                            iter, v[1]);
00565                 modifiedAny = true;
00566                 goto restart;
00567             }
00568             if (lIsUndef(v[1])) {
00569                 llvm::ReplaceInstWithValue(iter->getParent()->getInstList(), 
00570                                            iter, v[0]);
00571                 modifiedAny = true;
00572                 goto restart;
00573             }
00574 
00575             int mask = lGetMask(factor);
00576             llvm::Value *value = NULL;
00577             if (mask == 0)
00578                 // Mask all off -> replace with the first blend value
00579                 value = v[0];
00580             else if (mask == blend->allOnMask)
00581                 // Mask all on -> replace with the second blend value
00582                 value = v[1];
00583 
00584             if (value != NULL) {
00585                 llvm::ReplaceInstWithValue(iter->getParent()->getInstList(), 
00586                                            iter, value);
00587                 modifiedAny = true;
00588                 goto restart;
00589             }
00590         }
00591         else if (matchesMaskInstruction(callInst->getCalledFunction())) {
00592             llvm::Value *factor = callInst->getArgOperand(0);
00593             int mask = lGetMask(factor);
00594             if (mask != -1) {
00595                 // If the vector-valued mask has a known value, replace it
00596                 // with the corresponding integer mask from its elements
00597                 // high bits.
00598                 llvm::Value *value = LLVMInt32(mask);
00599                 llvm::ReplaceInstWithValue(iter->getParent()->getInstList(),
00600                                            iter, value);
00601                 modifiedAny = true;
00602                 goto restart;
00603             }
00604         }
00605 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0svn)
00606         else if (callInst->getCalledFunction() == avxMaskedLoad32 ||
00607                  callInst->getCalledFunction() == avxMaskedLoad64) {
00608             llvm::Value *factor = callInst->getArgOperand(1);
00609             int mask = lGetMask(factor);
00610             if (mask == 0) {
00611                 // nothing being loaded, replace with undef value
00612                 llvm::Type *returnType = callInst->getType();
00613                 assert(llvm::isa<llvm::VectorType>(returnType));
00614                 llvm::Value *undefValue = llvm::UndefValue::get(returnType);
00615                 llvm::ReplaceInstWithValue(iter->getParent()->getInstList(),
00616                                            iter, undefValue);
00617                 modifiedAny = true;
00618                 goto restart;
00619             }
00620             else if (mask == 0xff) {
00621                 // all lanes active; replace with a regular load
00622                 llvm::Type *returnType = callInst->getType();
00623                 assert(llvm::isa<llvm::VectorType>(returnType));
00624                 // cast the i8 * to the appropriate type
00625                 llvm::Value *castPtr = 
00626                     new llvm::BitCastInst(callInst->getArgOperand(0),
00627                                           llvm::PointerType::get(returnType, 0), 
00628                                           "ptr2vec", callInst);
00629                 lCopyMetadata(castPtr, callInst);
00630                 int align = callInst->getCalledFunction() == avxMaskedLoad32 ? 4 : 8;
00631                 llvm::Instruction *loadInst = 
00632                     new llvm::LoadInst(castPtr, "load", false /* not volatile */,
00633                                        align, (llvm::Instruction *)NULL);
00634                 lCopyMetadata(loadInst, callInst);
00635                 llvm::ReplaceInstWithInst(callInst, loadInst);
00636                 modifiedAny = true;
00637                 goto restart;
00638             }
00639         }
00640         else if (callInst->getCalledFunction() == avxMaskedStore32 ||
00641                  callInst->getCalledFunction() == avxMaskedStore64) {
00642             // NOTE: mask is the 2nd parameter, not the 3rd one!!
00643             llvm::Value *factor = callInst->getArgOperand(1);
00644             int mask = lGetMask(factor);
00645             if (mask == 0) {
00646                 // nothing actually being stored, just remove the inst
00647                 callInst->eraseFromParent();
00648                 modifiedAny = true;
00649                 goto restart;
00650             }
00651             else if (mask == 0xff) {
00652                 // all lanes storing, so replace with a regular store
00653                 llvm::Value *rvalue = callInst->getArgOperand(2);
00654                 llvm::Type *storeType = rvalue->getType();
00655                 llvm::Value *castPtr = 
00656                     new llvm::BitCastInst(callInst->getArgOperand(0),
00657                                           llvm::PointerType::get(storeType, 0), 
00658                                           "ptr2vec", callInst);
00659                 lCopyMetadata(castPtr, callInst);
00660 
00661                 llvm::StoreInst *storeInst = 
00662                     new llvm::StoreInst(rvalue, castPtr, (llvm::Instruction *)NULL);
00663                 int align = callInst->getCalledFunction() == avxMaskedStore32 ? 4 : 8;
00664                 storeInst->setAlignment(align);
00665                 lCopyMetadata(storeInst, callInst);
00666                 llvm::ReplaceInstWithInst(callInst, storeInst);
00667 
00668                 modifiedAny = true;
00669                 goto restart;
00670             }
00671         }
00672 #endif
00673     }
00674     return modifiedAny;
00675 }
00676 
00677 
00678 bool
00679 IntrinsicsOpt::matchesMaskInstruction(llvm::Function *function) {
00680     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < maskInstructions.size(); ++i)
00681         if (function == maskInstructions[i].function)
00682             return true;
00683     return false;
00684 }
00685 
00686 
00687 IntrinsicsOpt::BlendInstruction *
00688 IntrinsicsOpt::matchingBlendInstruction(llvm::Function *function) {
00689     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < blendInstructions.size(); ++i)
00690         if (function == blendInstructions[i].function)
00691             return &blendInstructions[i];
00692     return NULL;
00693 }
00694 
00695 
00696 static llvm::Pass *
00697 CreateIntrinsicsOptPass() {
00698     return new IntrinsicsOpt;
00699 }
00700 
00701 
00702 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00703 // GatherScatterFlattenOpt
00704 
00705 /** When the front-end emits gathers and scatters, it generates an array of
00706     vector-width pointers to represent the set of addresses to read from or
00707     write to.  However, because ispc doesn't support pointers, it turns
00708     out to be the case that scatters and gathers always end up indexing
00709     into an array with a common base pointer.  Therefore, this optimization
00710     transforms the original arrays of general pointers into a single base
00711     pointer and an array of offsets.
00712 
00713     (Implementation seems to be easier with this approach versus having the
00714     front-end try to emit base pointer + offset stuff from the start,
00715     though arguably the latter approach would be a little more elegant.)
00716 
00717     See for example the comments discussing the __pseudo_gather functions
00718     in builtins.cpp for more information about this.
00719 
00720     @todo The implementation of this is pretty messy, and it sure would be
00721     nice to not have all the complexity of built-in assumptions of the
00722     structure of how the front end will have generated code, all of the
00723     instruction dyn_casts, etc.  Can we do something simpler, e.g. an early
00724     pass to flatten out GEPs when the size is known, then do LLVM's
00725     constant folding, then flatten into an array, etc.?
00726  */
00727 class GatherScatterFlattenOpt : public llvm::BasicBlockPass {
00728 public:
00729     static char ID;
00730     GatherScatterFlattenOpt() : BasicBlockPass(ID) { }
00731 
00732     const char *getPassName() const { return "Gather/Scatter Flattening"; }
00733     bool runOnBasicBlock(llvm::BasicBlock &BB);
00734 };
00735 
00736 char GatherScatterFlattenOpt::ID = 0;
00737 
00738 llvm::RegisterPass<GatherScatterFlattenOpt> gsf("gs-flatten", "Gather/Scatter Flatten Pass");
00739 
00740 
00741 /** Given an llvm::Value known to be an unsigned integer, return its value as
00742     an int64_t.
00743 */
00744 static uint64_t
00745 lGetIntValue(llvm::Value *offset) {
00746     llvm::ConstantInt *intOffset = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ConstantInt>(offset);
00747     assert(intOffset && (intOffset->getBitWidth() == 32 ||
00748                          intOffset->getBitWidth() == 64));
00749     return intOffset->getZExtValue();
00750 }
00751 
00752 
00753 /** Returns the size of the given llvm::Type as an llvm::Value, if the size
00754     can be easily determined at compile type.  If it's not easy to figure
00755     out the size, this just returns NULL and we handle finding its size
00756     differently.
00757  */
00758 static bool
00759 lSizeOfIfKnown(const llvm::Type *type, uint64_t *size) {
00760     if (type == LLVMTypes::Int8Type) {
00761         *size = 1;
00762         return true;
00763     }
00764     if (type == LLVMTypes::Int8VectorType) {
00765         *size = g->target.vectorWidth * 1;
00766         return true;
00767     }
00768     else if (type == LLVMTypes::Int16Type) {
00769         *size = 2;
00770         return true;
00771     }
00772     if (type == LLVMTypes::Int16VectorType) {
00773         *size = g->target.vectorWidth * 2;
00774         return true;
00775     }
00776     else if (type == LLVMTypes::FloatType || type == LLVMTypes::Int32Type) {
00777         *size = 4;
00778         return true;
00779     }
00780     else if (type == LLVMTypes::FloatVectorType || type == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType) {
00781         *size = g->target.vectorWidth * 4;
00782         return true;
00783     }
00784     else if (type == LLVMTypes::DoubleType || type == LLVMTypes::Int64Type) {
00785         *size = 8;
00786         return true;
00787     }
00788     else if (type == LLVMTypes::DoubleVectorType || type == LLVMTypes::Int64VectorType) {
00789         *size = g->target.vectorWidth * 8;
00790         return true;
00791     }
00792     else if (llvm::isa<const llvm::ArrayType>(type)) {
00793         const llvm::ArrayType *at = llvm::dyn_cast<const llvm::ArrayType>(type);
00794         uint64_t eltSize;
00795         if (lSizeOfIfKnown(at->getElementType(), &eltSize)) {
00796             *size = eltSize * at->getNumElements();
00797             return true;
00798         }
00799         else
00800             return false;
00801     }
00802     return false;
00803 }
00804 
00805 
00806 /** This function returns an llvm::Value giving the size of the given type.
00807     If any instructions need to be generated to compute the size, they are
00808     inserted before insertBefore.
00809  */
00810 static llvm::Value *
00811 lSizeOf(LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *type, llvm::Instruction *insertBefore) {
00812     // First try the easy case and see if we can get it as a simple
00813     // constant..
00814     uint64_t size;
00815     if (lSizeOfIfKnown(type, &size))
00816         return LLVMInt64(size);
00817 
00818     // Otherwise use the trick of doing a GEP with a NULL pointer to get
00819     // the pointer to the second element of an array of items of this type.
00820     // Then convert that pointer to an int and we've got the offset to the
00821     // second element in the array, a.k.a. the size of the type.
00822     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *ptrType = llvm::PointerType::get(type, 0);
00823     llvm::Value *nullPtr = llvm::Constant::getNullValue(ptrType);
00824     llvm::Value *index[1] = { LLVMInt32(1) };
00825 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0svn)
00826     llvm::ArrayRef<llvm::Value *> arrayRef(&index[0], &index[1]);
00827     llvm::Value *poffset = llvm::GetElementPtrInst::Create(nullPtr, arrayRef,
00828                                                            "offset_ptr", insertBefore);
00829 #else
00830     llvm::Value *poffset = llvm::GetElementPtrInst::Create(nullPtr, &index[0], &index[1],
00831                                                            "offset_ptr", insertBefore);
00832 #endif
00833     lCopyMetadata(poffset, insertBefore);
00834     llvm::Instruction *inst = new llvm::PtrToIntInst(poffset, LLVMTypes::Int64Type, 
00835                                                      "offset_int", insertBefore);
00836     lCopyMetadata(inst, insertBefore);
00837     return inst;
00838 }
00839 
00840 
00841 /** This function returns a value that gives the offset in bytes from the
00842     start of the given structure type to the given struct member.  The
00843     instructions that compute this value are inserted before insertBefore.
00844  */
00845 static llvm::Value *
00846 lStructOffset(LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *type, uint64_t member, 
00847               llvm::Instruction *insertBefore) {
00848     // Do a similar trick to the one done in lSizeOf above; compute the
00849     // pointer to the member starting from a NULL base pointer and then
00850     // cast that 'pointer' to an int...
00851     assert(llvm::isa<const llvm::StructType>(type));
00852     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *ptrType = llvm::PointerType::get(type, 0);
00853     llvm::Value *nullPtr = llvm::Constant::getNullValue(ptrType);
00854     llvm::Value *index[2] = { LLVMInt32(0), LLVMInt32((int32_t)member) };
00855 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0svn)
00856     llvm::ArrayRef<llvm::Value *> arrayRef(&index[0], &index[2]);
00857     llvm::Value *poffset = llvm::GetElementPtrInst::Create(nullPtr, arrayRef,
00858                                                            "member_ptr", insertBefore);
00859 #else
00860     llvm::Value *poffset = llvm::GetElementPtrInst::Create(nullPtr, &index[0], &index[2],
00861                                                            "member_ptr", insertBefore);
00862 #endif
00863     lCopyMetadata(poffset, insertBefore);
00864     llvm::Instruction *inst = new llvm::PtrToIntInst(poffset, LLVMTypes::Int64Type, 
00865                                                      "member_int", insertBefore);
00866     lCopyMetadata(inst, insertBefore);
00867     return inst;
00868 }
00869 
00870 
00871 static llvm::Value *
00872 lGetTypeSize(LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *type, llvm::Instruction *insertBefore) {
00873     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType *arrayType =  
00874         llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType>(type);
00875     if (arrayType != NULL)
00876         type = arrayType->getElementType();
00877 
00878     llvm::Value *scale = lSizeOf(type, insertBefore);
00879     llvm::Instruction *inst = new llvm::TruncInst(scale, LLVMTypes::Int32Type, "sizeof32", 
00880                                                   insertBefore);
00881     lCopyMetadata(inst, insertBefore);
00882     return inst;
00883 }
00884 
00885 
00886 static llvm::Value *
00887 lGetOffsetForLane(int lane, llvm::Value *value, llvm::Value **offset, 
00888                   LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type **scaleType, bool *leafIsVarying,
00889                   llvm::Instruction *insertBefore) {
00890     if (!llvm::isa<llvm::GetElementPtrInst>(value)) {
00891         assert(llvm::isa<llvm::BitCastInst>(value));
00892         value = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::BitCastInst>(value)->getOperand(0);
00893 
00894         llvm::ExtractValueInst *ev = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ExtractValueInst>(value);
00895         assert(ev->hasIndices() && ev->getNumIndices() == 1);
00896         assert(int(*(ev->idx_begin())) == lane);
00897 
00898         llvm::InsertValueInst *iv = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::InsertValueInst>(ev->getOperand(0));
00899         assert(iv->hasIndices() && iv->getNumIndices() == 1);
00900         while (int(*(iv->idx_begin())) != lane) {
00901             iv = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::InsertValueInst>(iv->getOperand(0));
00902             assert(iv && iv->hasIndices() && iv->getNumIndices() == 1);
00903         }
00904     
00905         value = iv->getOperand(1);
00906     }
00907 
00908     if (leafIsVarying != NULL) {
00909         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *pt = value->getType();
00910         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::PointerType *ptrType = 
00911             llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::PointerType>(pt);
00912         assert(ptrType);
00913         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *eltType = ptrType->getElementType();
00914         *leafIsVarying = llvm::isa<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType>(eltType);
00915     }
00916 
00917     llvm::GetElementPtrInst *gep = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::GetElementPtrInst>(value);
00918     assert(gep);
00919 
00920     assert(lGetIntValue(gep->getOperand(1)) == 0);
00921     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::PointerType *targetPtrType = 
00922         llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::PointerType>(gep->getOperand(0)->getType());
00923     assert(targetPtrType);
00924     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *targetType = targetPtrType->getElementType();
00925 
00926     if (llvm::isa<const llvm::StructType>(targetType)) {
00927         *offset = lStructOffset(targetType, lGetIntValue(gep->getOperand(2)),
00928                                 insertBefore);
00929         *offset = new llvm::TruncInst(*offset, LLVMTypes::Int32Type, "member32", 
00930                                       insertBefore);
00931         lCopyMetadata(*offset, insertBefore);
00932         *scaleType = LLVMTypes::Int8Type; // aka char aka sizeof(1)
00933     }
00934     else {
00935         *offset = gep->getOperand(2);
00936         assert(*scaleType == NULL || *scaleType == targetType);
00937         *scaleType = targetType;
00938     }
00939 
00940     llvm::ExtractValueInst *ee = 
00941         llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ExtractValueInst>(gep->getOperand(0));
00942     if (ee == NULL) {
00943         // found the base pointer, here it is...
00944         return gep->getOperand(0);
00945     }
00946     else {
00947         assert(ee->hasIndices() && ee->getNumIndices() == 1 &&
00948                int(*(ee->idx_begin())) == lane);
00949         llvm::InsertValueInst *iv =
00950             llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::InsertValueInst>(ee->getOperand(0));
00951         assert(iv != NULL);
00952         // do this chain of inserts for the next dimension...
00953         return iv;
00954     }
00955 }
00956 
00957 
00958 /** We have an LLVM array of pointer values, where each pointer has been
00959     computed with a GEP from some common base pointer value.  This function
00960     deconstructs the LLVM array, storing the offset from the base pointer
00961     as an llvm::Value for the i'th element into the i'th element of the
00962     offsets[] array passed in to the function.  It returns a scale factor
00963     for the offsets via *scaleType, and sets *leafIsVarying to true if the
00964     leaf data type being indexed into is a 'varying' ispc type.  The
00965     return value is either the base pointer or the an array of pointers for
00966     the next dimension of indexing (that we'll in turn deconstruct with
00967     this function).
00968 
00969     @todo All of the additional indexing magic for varying stuff should
00970     happen in the front end.
00971  */
00972 static llvm::Value *
00973 lTraverseInsertChain(llvm::Value *ptrs, llvm::Value *offsets[ISPC_MAX_NVEC],
00974                      LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type **scaleType, bool *leafIsVarying,
00975                      llvm::Instruction *insertBefore) {
00976     // This depends on the front-end constructing the arrays of pointers
00977     // via InsertValue instructions.  (Which it does do in
00978     // FunctionEmitContext::GetElementPtrInst()).
00979     llvm::InsertValueInst *ivInst = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::InsertValueInst>(ptrs);
00980     assert(ivInst != NULL);
00981 
00982     // We have a chain of insert value instructions where each instruction
00983     // sets one of the elements of the array and where the input array is
00984     // either the base pointer or another insert value instruction.  Here
00985     // we talk through all of the insert value instructions until we hit
00986     // the end.
00987     llvm::Value *nextChain = NULL;
00988     while (ivInst != NULL) {
00989         // Figure out which array index this current instruction is setting
00990         // the value of.
00991         assert(ivInst->hasIndices() && ivInst->getNumIndices() == 1);
00992         int elementIndex = *(ivInst->idx_begin());
00993         assert(elementIndex >= 0 && elementIndex < g->target.vectorWidth);
00994         // We shouldn't have already seen something setting the value for
00995         // this index.
00996         assert(offsets[elementIndex] == NULL);
00997 
00998         // Set offsets[elementIndex] here.  This returns the value from
00999         // which the GEP operation was done; this should either be the base
01000         // pointer or an insert value chain for another dimension of the
01001         // array being indexed into.
01002         llvm::Value *myNext = lGetOffsetForLane(elementIndex, ivInst->getOperand(1), 
01003                                                 &offsets[elementIndex], scaleType,
01004                                                 leafIsVarying, insertBefore);
01005         if (nextChain == NULL)
01006             nextChain = myNext;
01007         else
01008             // All of these insert value instructions should have the same
01009             // base value
01010             assert(nextChain == myNext);
01011 
01012         // Do we have another element of the array to process?
01013         llvm::Value *nextInsert = ivInst->getOperand(0);
01014         ivInst = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::InsertValueInst>(nextInsert);
01015         if (!ivInst)
01016             assert(llvm::isa<llvm::UndefValue>(nextInsert));
01017     }
01018     return nextChain;
01019 }
01020 
01021 
01022 /** Given a scalar value, return a vector of width g->target.vectorWidth
01023     that has the scalar replicated across each of its elements.
01024 
01025     @todo Using shufflevector to do this seems more idiomatic (and would be
01026     just a single instruction).  Switch to that?
01027  */
01028 static llvm::Value *
01029 lSmearScalar(llvm::Value *scalar, llvm::Instruction *insertBefore) {
01030     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *vectorType = llvm::VectorType::get(scalar->getType(), 
01031                                                                    g->target.vectorWidth);
01032     llvm::Value *result = llvm::UndefValue::get(vectorType);
01033     for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i) {
01034         result = llvm::InsertElementInst::Create(result, scalar, LLVMInt32(i),
01035                                                  "smearinsert", insertBefore);
01036         lCopyMetadata(result, insertBefore);
01037     }
01038     return result;
01039 }
01040 
01041 
01042 static llvm::Value *
01043 lGetPtrAndOffsets(llvm::Value *ptrs, llvm::Value **basePtr, 
01044                   llvm::Instruction *insertBefore, int eltSize) {
01045     llvm::Value *offset = LLVMInt32Vector(0);
01046     bool firstLoop = true, leafIsVarying;
01047 
01048     while (ptrs != NULL) {
01049         llvm::Value *offsets[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
01050         for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i)
01051             offsets[i] = NULL;
01052         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *scaleType = NULL;
01053 
01054         llvm::Value *nextChain = 
01055             lTraverseInsertChain(ptrs, offsets, &scaleType,
01056                                  firstLoop ? &leafIsVarying : NULL, insertBefore);
01057 
01058         for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i)
01059             assert(offsets[i] != NULL);
01060         llvm::Value *delta = llvm::UndefValue::get(LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType);
01061         for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i) {
01062             delta = llvm::InsertElementInst::Create(delta, offsets[i],
01063                                                     LLVMInt32(i), "dim",
01064                                                     insertBefore);
01065             lCopyMetadata(delta, insertBefore);
01066         }
01067 
01068         llvm::Value *size = lGetTypeSize(scaleType, insertBefore);
01069 
01070         llvm::Value *scale = lSmearScalar(size, insertBefore);
01071         delta = llvm::BinaryOperator::Create(llvm::Instruction::Mul, delta, 
01072                                              scale, "delta_scale", insertBefore);
01073         lCopyMetadata(delta, insertBefore);
01074         offset = llvm::BinaryOperator::Create(llvm::Instruction::Add, offset, 
01075                                               delta, "offset_delta", 
01076                                               insertBefore);
01077         lCopyMetadata(offset, insertBefore);
01078 
01079         if (llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::InsertValueInst>(nextChain))
01080             ptrs = nextChain;
01081         else {
01082             // else we don't have a unique starting pointer....
01083             assert(*basePtr == NULL || *basePtr == nextChain);
01084             *basePtr = nextChain;
01085             break;
01086         }
01087         firstLoop = false;
01088     }
01089 
01090     // handle varying stuff...
01091     if (leafIsVarying) {
01092         llvm::Value *deltaVector = llvm::UndefValue::get(LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType);
01093         for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i) {
01094             deltaVector = 
01095                 llvm::InsertElementInst::Create(deltaVector, LLVMInt32(eltSize*i),
01096                                                 LLVMInt32(i), "delta", insertBefore);
01097             lCopyMetadata(deltaVector, insertBefore);
01098         }
01099         offset = llvm::BinaryOperator::Create(llvm::Instruction::Add, offset, 
01100                                               deltaVector, "offset_varying_delta", 
01101                                               insertBefore);
01102         lCopyMetadata(offset, insertBefore);
01103     }
01104 
01105     return offset;
01106 }
01107 
01108 
01109 struct GSInfo {
01110     GSInfo(const char *pgFuncName, const char *pgboFuncName, bool ig, int es) 
01111         : isGather(ig), elementSize(es) {
01112         func = m->module->getFunction(pgFuncName);
01113         baseOffsetsFunc = m->module->getFunction(pgboFuncName);
01114     }
01115     llvm::Function *func;
01116     llvm::Function *baseOffsetsFunc;
01117     const bool isGather;
01118     const int elementSize;
01119 };
01120 
01121 
01122 bool
01123 GatherScatterFlattenOpt::runOnBasicBlock(llvm::BasicBlock &bb) {
01124     GSInfo gsFuncs[] = {
01125         GSInfo("__pseudo_gather_8",  "__pseudo_gather_base_offsets_8",  true, 1),
01126         GSInfo("__pseudo_gather_16", "__pseudo_gather_base_offsets_16", true, 2),
01127         GSInfo("__pseudo_gather_32", "__pseudo_gather_base_offsets_32", true, 4),
01128         GSInfo("__pseudo_gather_64", "__pseudo_gather_base_offsets_64", true, 8),
01129         GSInfo("__pseudo_scatter_8",  "__pseudo_scatter_base_offsets_8",  false, 1),
01130         GSInfo("__pseudo_scatter_16", "__pseudo_scatter_base_offsets_16", false, 2),
01131         GSInfo("__pseudo_scatter_32", "__pseudo_scatter_base_offsets_32", false, 4),
01132         GSInfo("__pseudo_scatter_64", "__pseudo_scatter_base_offsets_64", false, 8),
01133     };
01134     int numGSFuncs = sizeof(gsFuncs) / sizeof(gsFuncs[0]);
01135     for (int i = 0; i < numGSFuncs; ++i)
01136         assert(gsFuncs[i].func != NULL && gsFuncs[i].baseOffsetsFunc != NULL);
01137 
01138     bool modifiedAny = false;
01139  restart:
01140     // Iterate through all of the instructions in the basic block.
01141     for (llvm::BasicBlock::iterator iter = bb.begin(), e = bb.end(); iter != e; ++iter) {
01142         llvm::CallInst *callInst = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::CallInst>(&*iter);
01143         // If we don't have a call to one of the
01144         // __pseudo_{gather,scatter}_* functions, then just go on to the
01145         // next instruction.
01146         if (callInst == NULL)
01147             continue;
01148         GSInfo *info = NULL;
01149         for (int i = 0; i < numGSFuncs; ++i)
01150             if (callInst->getCalledFunction() == gsFuncs[i].func) {
01151                 info = &gsFuncs[i];
01152                 break;
01153             }
01154         if (info == NULL)
01155             continue;
01156 
01157         // Transform the array of pointers to a single base pointer and an
01158         // array of int32 offsets.  (All the hard work is done by
01159         // lGetPtrAndOffsets).
01160         llvm::Value *ptrs = callInst->getArgOperand(0);
01161         llvm::Value *basePtr = NULL;
01162         llvm::Value *offsetVector = lGetPtrAndOffsets(ptrs, &basePtr, callInst, 
01163                                                       info->elementSize);
01164         // Cast the base pointer to a void *, since that's what the
01165         // __pseudo_*_base_offsets_* functions want.
01166         basePtr = new llvm::BitCastInst(basePtr, LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType,
01167                                         "base2void", callInst);
01168         lCopyMetadata(basePtr, callInst);
01169 
01170         if (info->isGather) {
01171             llvm::Value *mask = callInst->getArgOperand(1);
01172 
01173             // Generate a new function call to the next pseudo gather
01174             // base+offsets instruction.  Note that we're passing a NULL
01175             // llvm::Instruction to llvm::CallInst::Create; this means that
01176             // the instruction isn't inserted into a basic block and that
01177             // way we can then call ReplaceInstWithInst().
01178             llvm::Value *newArgs[3] = { basePtr, offsetVector, mask };
01179 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0svn)
01180             llvm::ArrayRef<llvm::Value *> newArgArray(&newArgs[0], &newArgs[3]);
01181             llvm::Instruction *newCall = 
01182                 llvm::CallInst::Create(info->baseOffsetsFunc, newArgArray,
01183                                        "newgather", (llvm::Instruction *)NULL);
01184 #else
01185             llvm::Instruction *newCall = 
01186                 llvm::CallInst::Create(info->baseOffsetsFunc, &newArgs[0], &newArgs[3],
01187                                        "newgather");
01188 #endif
01189             lCopyMetadata(newCall, callInst);
01190             llvm::ReplaceInstWithInst(callInst, newCall);
01191         }
01192         else {
01193             llvm::Value *mask = callInst->getArgOperand(2);
01194             llvm::Value *rvalue = callInst->getArgOperand(1);
01195 
01196             // Generate a new function call to the next pseudo scatter
01197             // base+offsets instruction.  See above for why passing NULL
01198             // for the Instruction * is intended.
01199             llvm::Value *newArgs[4] = { basePtr, offsetVector, rvalue, mask };
01200 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0svn)
01201             llvm::ArrayRef<llvm::Value *> newArgArray(&newArgs[0], &newArgs[4]);
01202             llvm::Instruction *newCall = 
01203                 llvm::CallInst::Create(info->baseOffsetsFunc, newArgArray, "", 
01204                                        (llvm::Instruction *)NULL);
01205 #else
01206             llvm::Instruction *newCall = 
01207                 llvm::CallInst::Create(info->baseOffsetsFunc, &newArgs[0], 
01208                                        &newArgs[4]);
01209 #endif
01210             lCopyMetadata(newCall, callInst);
01211             llvm::ReplaceInstWithInst(callInst, newCall);
01212         }
01213         modifiedAny = true;
01214         goto restart;
01215     }
01216     return modifiedAny;
01217 }
01218 
01219 
01220 static llvm::Pass *
01221 CreateGatherScatterFlattenPass() {
01222     return new GatherScatterFlattenOpt;
01223 }
01224 
01225 
01226 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01227 // MaskedStoreOptPass
01228 
01229 /** Masked stores are generally more complex than regular stores; for
01230     example, they require multiple instructions to simulate under SSE.
01231     This optimization detects cases where masked stores can be replaced
01232     with regular stores or removed entirely, for the cases of an 'all on'
01233     mask and an 'all off' mask, respectively.
01234  */
01235 class MaskedStoreOptPass : public llvm::BasicBlockPass {
01236 public:
01237     static char ID;
01238     MaskedStoreOptPass() : BasicBlockPass(ID) { }
01239 
01240     const char *getPassName() const { return "Masked Store Scalarize"; }
01241     bool runOnBasicBlock(llvm::BasicBlock &BB);
01242 };
01243 
01244 
01245 char MaskedStoreOptPass::ID = 0;
01246 
01247 llvm::RegisterPass<MaskedStoreOptPass> mss("masked-store-scalarize",
01248                                            "Masked Store Scalarize Pass");
01249 
01250 struct MSInfo {
01251     MSInfo(const char *name, const int a) 
01252         : align(a) {
01253         func = m->module->getFunction(name);
01254         assert(func != NULL);
01255     }
01256     llvm::Function *func;
01257     const int align;
01258 };
01259         
01260 
01261 bool
01262 MaskedStoreOptPass::runOnBasicBlock(llvm::BasicBlock &bb) {
01263     MSInfo msInfo[] = {
01264         MSInfo("__pseudo_masked_store_8",  1),
01265         MSInfo("__pseudo_masked_store_16", 2),
01266         MSInfo("__pseudo_masked_store_32", 4),
01267         MSInfo("__pseudo_masked_store_64", 8),
01268         MSInfo("__masked_store_blend_8",  1),
01269         MSInfo("__masked_store_blend_16", 2),
01270         MSInfo("__masked_store_blend_32", 4),
01271         MSInfo("__masked_store_blend_64", 8),
01272         MSInfo("__masked_store_8",  1),
01273         MSInfo("__masked_store_16", 2),
01274         MSInfo("__masked_store_32", 4),
01275         MSInfo("__masked_store_64", 8)
01276     };
01277 
01278     bool modifiedAny = false;
01279  restart:
01280     // Iterate over all of the instructions to look for one of the various
01281     // masked store functions
01282     for (llvm::BasicBlock::iterator iter = bb.begin(), e = bb.end(); iter != e; ++iter) {
01283         llvm::CallInst *callInst = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::CallInst>(&*iter);
01284         if (!callInst)
01285             continue;
01286 
01287         llvm::Function *called = callInst->getCalledFunction();
01288         int nMSFuncs = sizeof(msInfo) / sizeof(msInfo[0]);
01289         MSInfo *info = NULL;
01290         for (int i = 0; i < nMSFuncs; ++i) {
01291             if (called == msInfo[i].func) {
01292                 info = &msInfo[i];
01293                 break;
01294             }
01295         }
01296         if (info == NULL)
01297             continue;
01298 
01299         // Got one; grab the operands
01300         llvm::Value *lvalue = callInst->getArgOperand(0);
01301         llvm::Value *rvalue  = callInst->getArgOperand(1);
01302         llvm::Value *mask = callInst->getArgOperand(2);
01303 
01304         int allOnMask = (1 << g->target.vectorWidth) - 1;
01305 
01306         int maskAsInt = lGetMask(mask);
01307         if (maskAsInt == 0) {
01308             // Zero mask - no-op, so remove the store completely.  (This
01309             // may in turn lead to being able to optimize out instructions
01310             // that compute the rvalue...)
01311             callInst->eraseFromParent();
01312             modifiedAny = true;
01313             goto restart;
01314         }
01315         else if (maskAsInt == allOnMask) {
01316             // The mask is all on, so turn this into a regular store
01317             LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *rvalueType = rvalue->getType();
01318             LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *ptrType = 
01319                 llvm::PointerType::get(rvalueType, 0);
01320 
01321             lvalue = new llvm::BitCastInst(lvalue, ptrType, "lvalue_to_ptr_type", callInst);
01322             lCopyMetadata(lvalue, callInst);
01323             llvm::Instruction *store = 
01324                 new llvm::StoreInst(rvalue, lvalue, false /* not volatile */,
01325                                     info->align);
01326             lCopyMetadata(store, callInst);
01327             llvm::ReplaceInstWithInst(callInst, store);
01328 
01329             modifiedAny = true;
01330             goto restart;
01331         }
01332     }
01333     return modifiedAny;
01334 }
01335 
01336 
01337 static llvm::Pass *
01338 CreateMaskedStoreOptPass() {
01339     return new MaskedStoreOptPass;
01340 }
01341 
01342 
01343 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01344 // LowerMaskedStorePass
01345 
01346 /** When the front-end needs to do a masked store, it emits a
01347     __pseudo_masked_store_{8,16,32,64} call as a placeholder.  This pass
01348     lowers these calls to either __masked_store_{8,16,32,64} or
01349     __masked_store_blend_{8,16,32,64} calls.
01350   */
01351 class LowerMaskedStorePass : public llvm::BasicBlockPass {
01352 public:
01353     static char ID;
01354     LowerMaskedStorePass() : BasicBlockPass(ID) { }
01355 
01356     const char *getPassName() const { return "Lower Masked Stores"; }
01357     bool runOnBasicBlock(llvm::BasicBlock &BB);
01358 };
01359 
01360 
01361 char LowerMaskedStorePass::ID = 0;
01362 
01363 llvm::RegisterPass<LowerMaskedStorePass> lms("masked-store-lower",
01364                                              "Lower Masked Store Pass");
01365 
01366 
01367 /** This routine attempts to determine if the given pointer in lvalue is
01368     pointing to stack-allocated memory.  It's conservative in that it
01369     should never return true for non-stack allocated memory, but may return
01370     false for memory that actually is stack allocated.  The basic strategy
01371     is to traverse through the operands and see if the pointer originally
01372     comes from an AllocaInst.
01373  */
01374 static bool
01375 lIsStackVariablePointer(llvm::Value *lvalue) {
01376     llvm::BitCastInst *bc = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::BitCastInst>(lvalue);
01377     if (bc)
01378         return lIsStackVariablePointer(bc->getOperand(0));
01379     else {
01380         llvm::AllocaInst *ai = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::AllocaInst>(lvalue);
01381         if (ai)
01382             return true;
01383         else {
01384             llvm::GetElementPtrInst *gep = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::GetElementPtrInst>(lvalue);
01385             if (gep)
01386                 return lIsStackVariablePointer(gep->getOperand(0));
01387             else
01388                 return false;
01389         }
01390     }
01391 }
01392 
01393 
01394 struct LMSInfo {
01395     LMSInfo(const char *pname, const char *bname, const char *msname) {
01396         pseudoFunc = m->module->getFunction(pname);
01397         blendFunc = m->module->getFunction(bname);
01398         maskedStoreFunc = m->module->getFunction(msname);
01399         assert(pseudoFunc != NULL && blendFunc != NULL && 
01400                maskedStoreFunc != NULL);
01401     }
01402     llvm::Function *pseudoFunc;
01403     llvm::Function *blendFunc;
01404     llvm::Function *maskedStoreFunc;
01405 };
01406 
01407 
01408 bool
01409 LowerMaskedStorePass::runOnBasicBlock(llvm::BasicBlock &bb) {
01410     LMSInfo msInfo[] = {
01411         LMSInfo("__pseudo_masked_store_8", "__masked_store_blend_8", 
01412                 "__masked_store_8"),
01413         LMSInfo("__pseudo_masked_store_16", "__masked_store_blend_16", 
01414                 "__masked_store_16"),
01415         LMSInfo("__pseudo_masked_store_32", "__masked_store_blend_32", 
01416                 "__masked_store_32"),
01417         LMSInfo("__pseudo_masked_store_64", "__masked_store_blend_64", 
01418                 "__masked_store_64")
01419     };
01420 
01421     bool modifiedAny = false;
01422  restart:
01423     for (llvm::BasicBlock::iterator iter = bb.begin(), e = bb.end(); iter != e; ++iter) {
01424         // Iterate through all of the instructions and look for
01425         // __pseudo_masked_store_* calls.
01426         llvm::CallInst *callInst = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::CallInst>(&*iter);
01427         if (callInst == NULL)
01428             continue;
01429         LMSInfo *info = NULL;
01430         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < sizeof(msInfo) / sizeof(msInfo[0]); ++i) {
01431             if (callInst->getCalledFunction() == msInfo[i].pseudoFunc) {
01432                 info = &msInfo[i];
01433                 break;
01434             }
01435         }
01436         if (info == NULL)
01437             continue;
01438 
01439         llvm::Value *lvalue = callInst->getArgOperand(0);
01440         llvm::Value *rvalue  = callInst->getArgOperand(1);
01441         llvm::Value *mask = callInst->getArgOperand(2);
01442 
01443         // We need to choose between doing the load + blend + store trick,
01444         // or serializing the masked store.  Even on targets with a native
01445         // masked store instruction, this is preferable since it lets us
01446         // keep values in registers rather than going out to the stack.
01447         bool doBlend = (!g->opt.disableBlendedMaskedStores ||
01448                         lIsStackVariablePointer(lvalue));
01449 
01450         // Generate the call to the appropriate masked store function and
01451         // replace the __pseudo_* one with it.
01452         llvm::Function *fms = doBlend ? info->blendFunc : info->maskedStoreFunc;
01453         llvm::Value *args[3] = { lvalue, rvalue, mask };
01454 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0svn)
01455         llvm::ArrayRef<llvm::Value *> newArgArray(&args[0], &args[3]);
01456         llvm::Instruction *inst = llvm::CallInst::Create(fms, newArgArray, "", 
01457                                                          callInst);
01458 #else
01459         llvm::Instruction *inst = llvm::CallInst::Create(fms, &args[0], &args[3], "", 
01460                                                          callInst);
01461 #endif
01462         lCopyMetadata(inst, callInst);
01463 
01464         callInst->eraseFromParent();
01465         modifiedAny = true;
01466         goto restart;
01467     }
01468     return modifiedAny;
01469 }
01470 
01471 
01472 static llvm::Pass *
01473 CreateLowerMaskedStorePass() {
01474     return new LowerMaskedStorePass;
01475 }
01476 
01477 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01478 // GSImprovementsPass
01479 
01480 /** After earlier optimization passes have run, we are sometimes able to
01481     determine that gathers/scatters are actually accessing memory in a more
01482     regular fashion and then change the operation to something simpler and
01483     more efficient.  For example, if all of the lanes in a gather are
01484     reading from the same location, we can instead do a scalar load and
01485     broadcast.  This pass examines gathers and scatters and tries to
01486     simplify them if at all possible.
01487 
01488     @todo Currently, this only looks for all program instances going to the
01489     same location and all going to a linear sequence of locations in
01490     memory.  There are a number of other cases that might make sense to
01491     look for, including things that could be handled with a vector load +
01492     shuffle or things that could be handled with hybrids of e.g. 2 4-wide
01493     vector loads with AVX, etc.
01494  */
01495 class GSImprovementsPass : public llvm::BasicBlockPass {
01496 public:
01497     static char ID;
01498     GSImprovementsPass() : BasicBlockPass(ID) { }
01499 
01500     const char *getPassName() const { return "Gather/Scatter Improvements"; }
01501     bool runOnBasicBlock(llvm::BasicBlock &BB);
01502 };
01503 
01504 
01505 char GSImprovementsPass::ID = 0;
01506 
01507 llvm::RegisterPass<GSImprovementsPass> gsi("gs-improvements",
01508                                            "Gather/Scatter Improvements Pass");
01509 
01510 
01511 #if 0
01512 // Debugging routine: dump the values of all of the elmenets in a
01513 // flattened-out vector
01514 static void lPrintVector(const char *info, llvm::Value *elements[ISPC_MAX_NVEC]) {
01515     fprintf(stderr, "--- %s ---\n", info);
01516     for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i) {
01517         fprintf(stderr, "%d: ", i);
01518         elements[i]->dump();
01519     }
01520     fprintf(stderr, "-----\n");
01521 }
01522 #endif
01523 
01524 
01525 /** Given an LLVM vector in vec, return a 'scalarized' version of the
01526     vector in the provided scalarizedVector[] array.  For example, if the
01527     vector value passed in is:
01528 
01529     add <4 x i32> %a_smear, <4 x i32> <4, 8, 12, 16>,
01530 
01531     and if %a_smear was computed by replicating a scalar value i32 %a
01532     across all of the elements of %a_smear, then the values returned will
01533     be:
01534 
01535     offsets[0] = add i32 %a, i32 4
01536     offsets[1] = add i32 %a, i32 8
01537     offsets[2] = add i32 %a, i32 12
01538     offsets[3] = add i32 %a, i32 16
01539     
01540     This function isn't fully general, but it seems to be able to handle
01541     all of the patterns that currently arise in practice.  If it can't
01542     scalarize a vector value, then it just returns false and the calling
01543     code proceeds as best it can without this information.
01544 
01545     @param vec               Vector to be scalarized
01546     @param scalarizedVector  Array in which to store the individual vector 
01547                              elements
01548     @param vectorLength      Number of elements in the given vector. (The
01549                              passed scalarizedVector array must also be at least
01550                              this length as well.)
01551     @returns                 True if the vector was successfully scalarized and
01552                              the values in offsets[] are valid; false otherwise
01553  */
01554 static bool
01555 lScalarizeVector(llvm::Value *vec, llvm::Value **scalarizedVector,
01556                  int vectorLength) {
01557     // First initialize the values of scalarizedVector[] to NULL.
01558     for (int i = 0; i < vectorLength; ++i)
01559         scalarizedVector[i] = NULL;
01560     
01561     // It may be ok for the vector to be an undef vector; these come up for
01562     // example in shufflevector instructions.  As long as elements of the
01563     // undef vector aren't referenced by the shuffle indices, this is fine.
01564     if (llvm::isa<llvm::UndefValue>(vec))
01565         return true;
01566 
01567     // ConstantVectors are easy; just pull out the individual constant
01568     // element values
01569     llvm::ConstantVector *cv = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ConstantVector>(vec);
01570     if (cv != NULL) {
01571         for (int i = 0; i < vectorLength; ++i)
01572             scalarizedVector[i] = cv->getOperand(i);
01573         return true;
01574     }
01575 
01576     // It's also easy if it's just a vector of all zeros
01577     llvm::ConstantAggregateZero *caz = 
01578         llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ConstantAggregateZero>(vec);
01579     if (caz != NULL) {
01580         for (int i = 0; i < vectorLength; ++i)
01581             scalarizedVector[i] = LLVMInt32(0);
01582         return true;
01583     }
01584 
01585     llvm::BinaryOperator *bo = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::BinaryOperator>(vec);
01586     if (bo) {
01587         // BinaryOperators are handled by attempting to scalarize both of
01588         // the operands.  If we're successful at this, then the vector of
01589         // scalar values we return from here are synthesized with scalar
01590         // versions of the original vector binary operator
01591         llvm::Instruction::BinaryOps opcode = bo->getOpcode();
01592         llvm::Value **v0 = 
01593             (llvm::Value **)alloca(vectorLength * sizeof(llvm::Value *));
01594         llvm::Value **v1 = 
01595             (llvm::Value **)alloca(vectorLength * sizeof(llvm::Value *));
01596 
01597         if (!lScalarizeVector(bo->getOperand(0), v0, vectorLength) || 
01598             !lScalarizeVector(bo->getOperand(1), v1, vectorLength))
01599             return false;
01600 
01601         for (int i = 0; i < vectorLength; ++i) {
01602             scalarizedVector[i] = 
01603                 llvm::BinaryOperator::Create(opcode, v0[i], v1[i], "flat_bop", bo);
01604             lCopyMetadata(scalarizedVector[i], bo);
01605         }
01606 
01607         return true;
01608     }
01609 
01610     llvm::InsertElementInst *ie = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::InsertElementInst>(vec);
01611     if (ie != NULL) {
01612         // If we have an InsertElement instruction, we generally have a
01613         // chain along the lines of:
01614         //
01615         // %v0 = insertelement undef, value_0, i32 index_0
01616         // %v1 = insertelement %v1,   value_1, i32 index_1
01617         // ...
01618         // %vn = insertelement %vn-1, value_n-1, i32 index_n-1
01619         //
01620         // We start here witn %vn and work backwards through the chain of
01621         // insertelement instructions until we get to the undef value that
01622         // started it all.  At each instruction, we set the appropriate
01623         // vaue in scalarizedVector[] based on the value being inserted.
01624         while (ie != NULL) {
01625             uint64_t iOffset = lGetIntValue(ie->getOperand(2));
01626             assert((int)iOffset < vectorLength);
01627             assert(scalarizedVector[iOffset] == NULL);
01628 
01629             scalarizedVector[iOffset] = ie->getOperand(1);
01630 
01631             llvm::Value *insertBase = ie->getOperand(0);
01632             ie = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::InsertElementInst>(insertBase);
01633             if (!ie)
01634                 assert(llvm::isa<llvm::UndefValue>(insertBase));
01635         }
01636         return true;
01637     }
01638 
01639     llvm::CastInst *ci = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::CastInst>(vec);
01640     if (ci != NULL) {
01641         // Casts are similar to BinaryOperators in that we attempt to
01642         // scalarize the vector being cast and if successful, we apply
01643         // equivalent scalar cast operators to each of the values in the
01644         // scalarized vector.
01645         llvm::Instruction::CastOps op = ci->getOpcode();
01646 
01647         llvm::Value **scalarizedTarget = 
01648             (llvm::Value **)alloca(vectorLength * sizeof(llvm::Value *));
01649         if (!lScalarizeVector(ci->getOperand(0), scalarizedTarget,
01650                               vectorLength))
01651             return false;
01652 
01653         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *destType = ci->getDestTy();
01654         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType *vectorDestType =
01655             llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType>(destType);
01656         assert(vectorDestType != NULL);
01657         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *elementType = vectorDestType->getElementType();
01658 
01659         for (int i = 0; i < vectorLength; ++i) {
01660             scalarizedVector[i] = 
01661                 llvm::CastInst::Create(op, scalarizedTarget[i], elementType,
01662                                        "cast", ci);
01663             lCopyMetadata(scalarizedVector[i], ci);
01664         }
01665         return true;
01666     }
01667 
01668     llvm::ShuffleVectorInst *svi = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ShuffleVectorInst>(vec);
01669     if (svi != NULL) {
01670         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType *svInstType = 
01671             llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType>(svi->getType());
01672         assert(svInstType != NULL);
01673         assert((int)svInstType->getNumElements() == vectorLength);
01674 
01675         // Scalarize the two vectors being shuffled.  First figure out how
01676         // big they are.
01677         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *type0 = svi->getOperand(0)->getType();
01678         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *type1 = svi->getOperand(1)->getType();
01679         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType *vectorType0 = 
01680             llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType>(type0);
01681         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType *vectorType1 = 
01682             llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType>(type1);
01683         assert(vectorType0 != NULL && vectorType1 != NULL);
01684 
01685         int n0 = vectorType0->getNumElements();
01686         int n1 = vectorType1->getNumElements();
01687 
01688         // Go ahead and scalarize the two input vectors now.
01689         llvm::Value **v0 = (llvm::Value **)alloca(n0 * sizeof(llvm::Value *));
01690         llvm::Value **v1 = (llvm::Value **)alloca(n1 * sizeof(llvm::Value *));
01691 
01692         if (!lScalarizeVector(svi->getOperand(0), v0, n0) ||
01693             !lScalarizeVector(svi->getOperand(1), v1, n1))
01694             return false;
01695 
01696         llvm::ConstantAggregateZero *caz = 
01697             llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ConstantAggregateZero>(svi->getOperand(2));
01698         if (caz != NULL) {
01699             for (int i = 0; i < vectorLength; ++i)
01700                 scalarizedVector[i] = v0[0];
01701         }
01702         else {
01703             llvm::ConstantVector *shuffleIndicesVector = 
01704                 llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ConstantVector>(svi->getOperand(2));
01705             // I think this has to be a ConstantVector.  If this ever hits,
01706             // we'll dig into what we got instead and figure out how to handle
01707             // that...
01708             assert(shuffleIndicesVector != NULL);
01709 
01710             // Get the integer indices for each element of the returned vector
01711             llvm::SmallVector<llvm::Constant *, ISPC_MAX_NVEC> shuffleIndices;
01712             shuffleIndicesVector->getVectorElements(shuffleIndices);
01713             assert((int)shuffleIndices.size() == vectorLength);
01714 
01715             // And loop over the indices, setting the i'th element of the
01716             // result vector with the source vector element that corresponds to
01717             // the i'th shuffle index value.
01718             for (unsigned int i = 0; i < shuffleIndices.size(); ++i) {
01719                 // I'm not sure when this case would ever happen, though..
01720                 assert(llvm::isa<llvm::ConstantInt>(shuffleIndices[i]));
01721 
01722                 int offset = (int)lGetIntValue(shuffleIndices[i]);
01723                 assert(offset >= 0 && offset < n0+n1);
01724 
01725                 if (offset < n0)
01726                     // Offsets from 0 to n0-1 index into the first vector
01727                     scalarizedVector[i] = v0[offset];
01728                 else
01729                     // And offsets from n0 to (n0+n1-1) index into the second
01730                     // vector
01731                     scalarizedVector[i] = v1[offset - n0];
01732             }
01733         }
01734         return true;
01735     }
01736 
01737     llvm::LoadInst *li = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::LoadInst>(vec);
01738     if (li != NULL) {
01739         llvm::Value *baseAddr = li->getOperand(0);
01740         llvm::Value *baseInt = new llvm::PtrToIntInst(baseAddr, LLVMTypes::Int64Type,
01741                                                       "base2int", li);
01742         lCopyMetadata(baseInt, li);
01743 
01744         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::PointerType *ptrType = 
01745             llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::PointerType>(baseAddr->getType());
01746         assert(ptrType != NULL);
01747         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType *vecType = 
01748             llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::VectorType>(ptrType->getElementType());
01749         assert(vecType != NULL);
01750         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *elementType = vecType->getElementType();
01751         uint64_t elementSize;
01752         bool sizeKnown = lSizeOfIfKnown(elementType, &elementSize);
01753         assert(sizeKnown == true);
01754 
01755         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *eltPtrType = llvm::PointerType::get(elementType, 0);
01756 
01757         for (int i = 0; i < vectorLength; ++i) {
01758             llvm::Value *intPtrOffset = 
01759                 llvm::BinaryOperator::Create(llvm::Instruction::Add, baseInt,
01760                                              LLVMInt64(i * elementSize), "baseoffset",
01761                                              li);
01762             lCopyMetadata(intPtrOffset, li);
01763             llvm::Value *scalarLoadPtr = 
01764                 new llvm::IntToPtrInst(intPtrOffset, eltPtrType, "int2ptr", li);
01765             lCopyMetadata(scalarLoadPtr, li);
01766 
01767             llvm::Instruction *scalarLoad = 
01768                 new llvm::LoadInst(scalarLoadPtr, "loadelt", li);
01769             lCopyMetadata(scalarLoad, li);
