01770             scalarizedVector[i] = scalarLoad;
01771         }
01772         return true;
01773     }
01774 
01775 #if 0
01776     fprintf(stderr, "flatten vector fixme\n");
01777     vec->dump();
01778     assert(0);
01779 #endif
01780 
01781     return false;
01782 }
01783 
01784 
01785 /** Conservative test to see if two values are equal.  There are
01786     (potentially many) cases where the two values actually are equal but
01787     this will return false.  However, if it does return true, the two
01788     vectors definitely are equal.  
01789 
01790     @todo This seems to catch all of the cases we currently need it for in
01791     practice, but it's be nice to make it a little more robust/general.  In
01792     general, though, a little something called the halting problem means we
01793     won't get all of them.
01794  */
01795 static bool
01796 lValuesAreEqual(llvm::Value *v0, llvm::Value *v1) {
01797     // Thanks to the fact that LLVM hashes and returns the same pointer for
01798     // constants (of all sorts, even constant expressions), this first test
01799     // actually catches a lot of cases.  LLVM's SSA form also helps a lot
01800     // with this..
01801     if (v0 == v1)
01802         return true;
01803 
01804     llvm::BinaryOperator *bo0 = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::BinaryOperator>(v0);
01805     llvm::BinaryOperator *bo1 = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::BinaryOperator>(v1);
01806     if (bo0 && bo1) {
01807         if (bo0->getOpcode() != bo1->getOpcode())
01808             return false;
01809         return (lValuesAreEqual(bo0->getOperand(0), bo1->getOperand(0)) &&
01810                 lValuesAreEqual(bo0->getOperand(1), bo1->getOperand(1)));
01811     }
01812 
01813     return false;
01814 }
01815 
01816 
01817 /** Tests to see if all of the llvm::Values in the array are equal.  Like
01818     lValuesAreEqual, this is a conservative test and may return false for
01819     arrays where the values are actually all equal.
01820  */
01821 static bool
01822 lVectorValuesAllEqual(llvm::Value *v[ISPC_MAX_NVEC]) {
01823     for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth-1; ++i)
01824         if (!lValuesAreEqual(v[i], v[i+1]))
01825             return false;
01826     return true;
01827 }
01828 
01829 
01830 /** Given an array of scalar integer values, test to see if they are a
01831     linear sequence of compile-time constant integers starting from an
01832     arbirary value but then having a step of value "stride" between
01833     elements.
01834  */
01835 static bool
01836 lVectorIsLinearConstantInts(llvm::Value *v[ISPC_MAX_NVEC], int stride) {
01837     llvm::ConstantInt *prev = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ConstantInt>(v[0]);
01838     if (!prev)
01839         return false;
01840     int prevVal = (int)prev->getZExtValue();
01841 
01842     // For each element in the array, see if it is both a ConstantInt and
01843     // if the difference between it and the value of the previous element
01844     // is stride.  If not, fail.
01845     for (int i = 1; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i) {
01846         llvm::ConstantInt *next = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ConstantInt>(v[i]);
01847         if (!next) 
01848             return false;
01849 
01850         int nextVal = (int)next->getZExtValue();
01851         if (prevVal + stride != nextVal)
01852             return false;
01853 
01854         prevVal = nextVal;
01855     }
01856     return true;
01857 }
01858 
01859 
01860 /** Given an array of integer-typed values, see if the elements of the
01861     array have a step of 'stride' between their values.  This function
01862     tries to handle as many possibilities as possible, including things
01863     like all elements equal to some non-constant value plus an integer
01864     offset, etc.
01865 
01866     @todo FIXME Crazy thought: can we just build up expressions that
01867     subtract the constants [v[0], v[0]+stride, v[0]+2*stride, ...] from the
01868     given values, throw the LLVM optimizer at those, and then see if we get
01869     back an array of all zeros?
01870  */
01871 static bool
01872 lVectorIsLinear(llvm::Value *v[ISPC_MAX_NVEC], int stride) {
01873 #if 0
01874     lPrintVector("called lVectorIsLinear", v);
01875 #endif
01876 
01877     // First try the easy case: if the values are all just constant
01878     // integers and have the expected stride between them, then we're done.
01879     if (lVectorIsLinearConstantInts(v, stride))
01880         return true;
01881 
01882     // ConstantExprs need a bit of deconstruction to figure out
01883 
01884     // FIXME: do we need to handle cases where e.g. v[0] is an
01885     // llvm::ConstantInt and then the rest are ConstExprs??
01886     if (llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ConstantExpr>(v[0])) {
01887         // First, see if all of the array elements are ConstantExprs of
01888         // some sort.  If not, give up.
01889         // FIXME: are we potentially missing cases here, e.g. a mixture of
01890         // ConstantExprs and ConstantInts?
01891         for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i) {
01892             if (!llvm::isa<llvm::ConstantExpr>(v[i]))
01893                 return false;
01894         }
01895 
01896         // See if any of the array elements are adds of constant
01897         // expressions.  As it turns out, LLVM's constant expression
01898         // optimizer is very thorough about converting "add(0, foo)" to
01899         // "foo", so we need to deal with cases where element 0 is "foo",
01900         // element 1 is add(4, foo), etc...
01901         bool anyAdds = false, allAdds = true;
01902         for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i) {
01903             llvm::ConstantExpr *ce = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ConstantExpr>(v[i]);
01904             if (ce->getOpcode() == llvm::Instruction::Add)
01905                 anyAdds = true;
01906             else 
01907                 allAdds = false;
01908         }
01909 
01910         if (anyAdds && !allAdds) {
01911             // In v[], we should have an array of elements that are all
01912             // either ConstExprs with add operators, where one of the
01913             // operads is a constant int, or other non-add ConstExpr
01914             // values.  
01915             // 
01916             // Now we through each element and:
01917             // 1. For ones that aren't add ConstExprs, treat them as if they 
01918             //    are an add with 0 as the other operand.
01919             // 2. Extract the ConstInt operand of the add into the intBit[]
01920             //    array and put the other operand in the otherBit[] array.
01921             llvm::Value *intBit[ISPC_MAX_NVEC], *otherBit[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
01922             for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i) {
01923                 llvm::ConstantExpr *ce = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ConstantExpr>(v[i]);
01924                 if (ce->getOpcode() == llvm::Instruction::Add) {
01925                     // The ConstantInt may be either of the two operands of
01926                     // the add.  Put the operands in the right arrays.
01927                     if (llvm::isa<llvm::ConstantInt>(ce->getOperand(0))) {
01928                         intBit[i] = ce->getOperand(0);
01929                         otherBit[i] = ce->getOperand(1);
01930                     }
01931                     else {
01932                         intBit[i] = ce->getOperand(1);
01933                         otherBit[i] = ce->getOperand(0);
01934                     }
01935                 }
01936                 else {
01937                     // We don't have an Add, so pretend we have an add with
01938                     // zero.
01939                     intBit[i] = LLVMInt32(0);
01940                     otherBit[i] = v[i];
01941                 }
01942             }
01943 
01944             // Now that everything is lined up, see if we have a case where
01945             // we're adding constant values with the desired stride to the
01946             // same base value.  If so, we know we have a linear set of
01947             // locations.
01948             return (lVectorIsLinear(intBit, stride) &&
01949                     lVectorValuesAllEqual(otherBit));
01950         }
01951 
01952         // If this ever hits, the assertion can just be commented out and
01953         // false returned below.  However, it's worth figuring out how the
01954         // analysis needs to be generalized rather than necessarily giving
01955         // up and possibly hurting performance of the final code.
01956         FATAL("Unexpected case with a ConstantExpr in lVectorIsLinear");
01957 #if 0
01958         for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i)
01959             v[i]->dump();
01960         FATAL("FIXME");
01961 #endif
01962         return false;
01963     }
01964 
01965 
01966     llvm::BinaryOperator *bop = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::BinaryOperator>(v[0]);
01967     if (bop) {
01968         // We also need to deal with non-constant binary operators that
01969         // represent linear accesses here..
01970         // FIXME: here, too, what about cases with v[0] being a load or something
01971         // and then everything after element 0 being a binary operator with an add.
01972         // That won't get caught by this case??
01973         bool anyAdd = false;
01974         for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i) {
01975             llvm::BinaryOperator *bopi = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::BinaryOperator>(v[i]);
01976             if (bopi && bopi->getOpcode() == llvm::Instruction::Add)
01977                 anyAdd = true;
01978         }
01979 
01980         if (anyAdd) {
01981             // is one of the operands the same for all elements?  if so, then just
01982             // need to check this case for the other operand...
01983 
01984             // FIXME: do we need a more general check that starts with both
01985             // the first and second operand of v[0]'s add and then checks
01986             // the remainder of the elements to see if either one of their
01987             // two operands matches the one we started with?  That would be
01988             // more robust to switching the ordering of operands, in case
01989             // that ever happens...
01990             for (int operand = 0; operand <= 1; ++operand) {
01991                 llvm::Value *addOperandValues[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
01992                 // Go through the vector elements and grab the operand'th
01993                 // one if this is an add or the v
01994                 for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i) {
01995                     llvm::BinaryOperator *bop = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::BinaryOperator>(v[i]);
01996                     if (bop->getOpcode() == llvm::Instruction::Add)
01997                         addOperandValues[i] = bop->getOperand(operand);
01998                     else
01999                         // The other guys are adds, so we'll treat this as
02000                         // an "add 0" in the below, so just grab the value
02001                         // v[i] itself
02002                         addOperandValues[i] = v[i];
02003                 }
02004 
02005                 if (lVectorValuesAllEqual(addOperandValues)) {
02006                     // If this operand's values are all equal, then the
02007                     // overall result is a linear sequence if the second
02008                     // operand's values are themselves a linear sequence...
02009                     int otherOperand = operand ^ 1;
02010                     for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i) {
02011                         llvm::BinaryOperator *bop = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::BinaryOperator>(v[i]);
02012                         if (bop->getOpcode() == llvm::Instruction::Add)
02013                             addOperandValues[i] = bop->getOperand(otherOperand);
02014                         else
02015                             addOperandValues[i] = LLVMInt32(0);
02016                     }
02017                     return lVectorIsLinear(addOperandValues, stride);
02018                 }
02019             }
02020         }
02021 
02022         if (bop->getOpcode() == llvm::Instruction::Mul) {
02023             // Finally, if we have a multiply, then if one of the operands
02024             // has the same value for all elements and if the other operand
02025             // is a linear sequence such that the scale times the sequence
02026             // values is a linear sequence with the desired stride, then
02027             // we're good.
02028             llvm::ConstantInt *op0 = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ConstantInt>(bop->getOperand(0));
02029             llvm::ConstantInt *op1 = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ConstantInt>(bop->getOperand(1));
02030 
02031             // We need one of them to be a constant for us to be able to proceed...
02032             if (!op0 && !op1)
02033                 return false;
02034             // But if they're both constants, then the LLVM constant folder
02035             // should have simplified them down to their product!
02036             assert(!(op0 && op1));
02037 
02038             // Figure out which operand number is the constant scale and
02039             // which is the varying one
02040             int scaleOperand, otherOperand;
02041             llvm::ConstantInt *scaleValue;
02042             if (op0 != NULL) {
02043                 scaleOperand = 0;
02044                 otherOperand = 1;
02045                 scaleValue = op0;
02046             }
02047             else {
02048                 scaleOperand = 1;
02049                 otherOperand = 0;
02050                 scaleValue = op1;
02051             }
02052 
02053             // Find the scale value; make sure it evenly divides the
02054             // stride.  Otherwise there's no chance that the scale times a
02055             // set of integer values will give a sequence with the desired
02056             // stride.
02057             int mulScale = (int)scaleValue->getZExtValue();
02058             if ((stride % mulScale) != 0)
02059                 return false;
02060 
02061             llvm::Value *otherValue[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
02062             for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i) {
02063                 llvm::BinaryOperator *eltBop = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::BinaryOperator>(v[i]);
02064                 // Give up if it's not matching the desired pattern of "all
02065                 // mul ops with the scaleOperand being a constant with the
02066                 // same value".
02067                 if (!eltBop || eltBop->getOpcode() != llvm::Instruction::Mul)
02068                     return false;
02069                 if (eltBop->getOperand(scaleOperand) != scaleValue)
02070                     return false;
02071 
02072                 otherValue[i] = eltBop->getOperand(otherOperand);
02073             }
02074             // Now see if the sequence of values being scaled gives us
02075             // something with the desired stride.
02076             return lVectorIsLinear(otherValue, stride / mulScale);
02077         }
02078     }
02079 
02080     return false;
02081 }
02082 
02083 
02084 struct GatherImpInfo {
02085     GatherImpInfo(const char *pName, const char *lbName, const char *lmName,
02086                   int a) 
02087         : align(a) {
02088         pseudoFunc = m->module->getFunction(pName);
02089         loadBroadcastFunc = m->module->getFunction(lbName);
02090         loadMaskedFunc = m->module->getFunction(lmName);
02091 
02092         assert(pseudoFunc != NULL && loadBroadcastFunc != NULL &&
02093                loadMaskedFunc != NULL);
02094     }
02095     llvm::Function *pseudoFunc;
02096     llvm::Function *loadBroadcastFunc;
02097     llvm::Function *loadMaskedFunc;
02098     const int align;
02099 };
02100 
02101 
02102 struct ScatterImpInfo {
02103     ScatterImpInfo(const char *pName, const char *msName, 
02104                    LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *vpt, int a)
02105         : align(a) {
02106         pseudoFunc = m->module->getFunction(pName);
02107         maskedStoreFunc = m->module->getFunction(msName);
02108         vecPtrType = vpt;
02109         assert(pseudoFunc != NULL && maskedStoreFunc != NULL);
02110     }
02111     llvm::Function *pseudoFunc;
02112     llvm::Function *maskedStoreFunc;
02113     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *vecPtrType;
02114     const int align;
02115 };
02116     
02117 
02118 bool
02119 GSImprovementsPass::runOnBasicBlock(llvm::BasicBlock &bb) {
02120     GatherImpInfo gInfo[] = {
02121         GatherImpInfo("__pseudo_gather_base_offsets_8", "__load_and_broadcast_8",
02122                       "__load_masked_8", 1),
02123         GatherImpInfo("__pseudo_gather_base_offsets_16", "__load_and_broadcast_16",
02124                       "__load_masked_16", 2),
02125         GatherImpInfo("__pseudo_gather_base_offsets_32", "__load_and_broadcast_32",
02126                       "__load_masked_32", 4),
02127         GatherImpInfo("__pseudo_gather_base_offsets_64", "__load_and_broadcast_64",
02128                       "__load_masked_64", 8)
02129     };
02130     ScatterImpInfo sInfo[] = {
02131         ScatterImpInfo("__pseudo_scatter_base_offsets_8",  "__pseudo_masked_store_8", 
02132                        LLVMTypes::Int8VectorPointerType, 1),
02133         ScatterImpInfo("__pseudo_scatter_base_offsets_16", "__pseudo_masked_store_16",
02134                        LLVMTypes::Int16VectorPointerType, 2),
02135         ScatterImpInfo("__pseudo_scatter_base_offsets_32", "__pseudo_masked_store_32",
02136                        LLVMTypes::Int32VectorPointerType, 4),
02137         ScatterImpInfo("__pseudo_scatter_base_offsets_64", "__pseudo_masked_store_64",
02138                        LLVMTypes::Int64VectorPointerType, 8)
02139     };
02140 
02141     bool modifiedAny = false;
02142 
02143  restart:
02144     for (llvm::BasicBlock::iterator iter = bb.begin(), e = bb.end(); iter != e; ++iter) {
02145         // Iterate over all of the instructions and look for calls to
02146         // __pseudo_*_base_offsets_* calls.
02147         llvm::CallInst *callInst = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::CallInst>(&*iter);
02148         if (callInst == NULL)
02149             continue;
02150         llvm::Function *calledFunc = callInst->getCalledFunction();
02151         GatherImpInfo *gatherInfo = NULL;
02152         ScatterImpInfo *scatterInfo = NULL;
02153         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < sizeof(gInfo) / sizeof(gInfo[0]); ++i) {
02154             if (calledFunc == gInfo[i].pseudoFunc) {
02155                 gatherInfo = &gInfo[i];
02156                 break;
02157             }
02158         }
02159         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < sizeof(sInfo) / sizeof(sInfo[0]); ++i) {
02160             if (calledFunc == sInfo[i].pseudoFunc) {
02161                 scatterInfo = &sInfo[i];
02162                 break;
02163             }
02164         }
02165         if (gatherInfo == NULL && scatterInfo == NULL)
02166             continue;
02167 
02168         SourcePos pos;
02169         bool ok = lGetSourcePosFromMetadata(callInst, &pos);
02170         assert(ok);     
02171 
02172         // Get the actual base pointer; note that it comes into the gather
02173         // or scatter function bitcast to an i8 *, so we need to work back
02174         // to get the pointer as the original type.
02175         llvm::Value *base = callInst->getArgOperand(0);
02176         llvm::BitCastInst *bci = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::BitCastInst>(base);
02177         if (bci)
02178             base = bci->getOperand(0);
02179         llvm::ConstantExpr *ce = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ConstantExpr>(base);
02180         if (ce && ce->getOpcode() == llvm::Instruction::BitCast)
02181             base = ce->getOperand(0);
02182 
02183         // Try to find out the offsets; the i'th element of the
02184         // offsetElements array should be an i32 with the value of the
02185         // offset for the i'th vector lane.  This may fail; if so, just
02186         // give up.
02187         llvm::Value *vecValue = callInst->getArgOperand(1);
02188         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType *vt = 
02189             llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::VectorType>(vecValue->getType());
02190         assert(vt != NULL);
02191         int vecLength = vt->getNumElements();
02192         assert(vecLength == g->target.vectorWidth);
02193         llvm::Value *offsetElements[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
02194         if (!lScalarizeVector(vecValue, offsetElements, vecLength))
02195             continue;
02196 
02197         llvm::Value *mask = callInst->getArgOperand((gatherInfo != NULL) ? 2 : 3);
02198 
02199         if (lVectorValuesAllEqual(offsetElements)) {
02200             // If all the offsets are equal, then compute the single
02201             // pointer they all represent based on the first one of them
02202             // (arbitrarily).
02203             llvm::Value *indices[1] = { offsetElements[0] };
02204             llvm::Value *basei8 =
02205                 new llvm::BitCastInst(base, LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType,
02206                                       "base2i8", callInst);
02207             lCopyMetadata(basei8, callInst);
02208 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0svn)
02209             llvm::ArrayRef<llvm::Value *> arrayRef(&indices[0], &indices[1]);
02210             llvm::Value *ptr = 
02211                 llvm::GetElementPtrInst::Create(basei8, arrayRef, "ptr", callInst);
02212 #else
02213             llvm::Value *ptr = 
02214                 llvm::GetElementPtrInst::Create(basei8, &indices[0], &indices[1],
02215                                                 "ptr", callInst);
02216 #endif
02217             lCopyMetadata(ptr, callInst);
02218 
02219             if (gatherInfo != NULL) {
02220                 // A gather with everyone going to the same location is
02221                 // handled as a scalar load and broadcast across the lanes.
02222                 // Note that we do still have to pass the mask to the
02223                 // __load_and_broadcast_* functions, since they shouldn't
02224                 // access memory if the mask is all off (the location may
02225                 // be invalid in that case).
02226                 Debug(pos, "Transformed gather to scalar load and broadcast!");
02227                 llvm::Value *args[2] = { ptr, mask };
02228 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0svn)
02229                 llvm::ArrayRef<llvm::Value *> newArgArray(&args[0], &args[2]);
02230                 llvm::Instruction *newCall = 
02231                     llvm::CallInst::Create(gatherInfo->loadBroadcastFunc, newArgArray,
02232                                            "load_broadcast", (llvm::Instruction *)NULL);
02233 #else
02234                 llvm::Instruction *newCall = 
02235                     llvm::CallInst::Create(gatherInfo->loadBroadcastFunc, &args[0], 
02236                                            &args[2], "load_broadcast");
02237 #endif
02238                 lCopyMetadata(newCall, callInst);
02239                 llvm::ReplaceInstWithInst(callInst, newCall);
02240             }
02241             else {
02242                 // A scatter with everyone going to the same location is
02243                 // undefined.  Issue a warning and arbitrarily let the
02244                 // first guy win.
02245                 Warning(pos, "Undefined behavior: all program instances are "
02246                         "writing to the same location!");
02247 
02248                 llvm::Value *rvalue = callInst->getArgOperand(2);
02249                 llvm::Value *first = 
02250                     llvm::ExtractElementInst::Create(rvalue, LLVMInt32(0), "rvalue_first",
02251                                                      callInst);
02252                 lCopyMetadata(first, callInst);
02253                 ptr = new llvm::BitCastInst(ptr, llvm::PointerType::get(first->getType(), 0),
02254                                             "ptr2rvalue_type", callInst);
02255                 lCopyMetadata(ptr, callInst);
02256                 llvm::Instruction *sinst = new llvm::StoreInst(first, ptr, false, 
02257                                                                scatterInfo->align);
02258                 lCopyMetadata(sinst, callInst);
02259                 llvm::ReplaceInstWithInst(callInst, sinst);
02260             }
02261 
02262             modifiedAny = true;
02263             goto restart;
02264         }
02265 
02266         int step = gatherInfo ? gatherInfo->align : scatterInfo->align;
02267         if (lVectorIsLinear(offsetElements, step)) {
02268             // We have a linear sequence of memory locations being accessed
02269             // starting with the location given by the offset from
02270             // offsetElements[0], with stride of 4 or 8 bytes (for 32 bit
02271             // and 64 bit gather/scatters, respectively.)
02272 
02273             // Get the base pointer using the first guy's offset.
02274             llvm::Value *indices[1] = { offsetElements[0] };
02275             llvm::Value *basei8 =
02276                 new llvm::BitCastInst(base, LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType, "base2i8", callInst);
02277             lCopyMetadata(basei8, callInst);
02278 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0svn)
02279             llvm::ArrayRef<llvm::Value *> arrayRef(&indices[0], &indices[1]);
02280             llvm::Value *ptr = 
02281                 llvm::GetElementPtrInst::Create(basei8, arrayRef, "ptr", callInst);
02282 #else
02283             llvm::Value *ptr = 
02284                 llvm::GetElementPtrInst::Create(basei8, &indices[0], &indices[1],
02285                                                 "ptr", callInst);
02286 #endif
02287             lCopyMetadata(ptr, callInst);
02288 
02289             if (gatherInfo != NULL) {
02290                 Debug(pos, "Transformed gather to unaligned vector load!");
02291                 llvm::Value *args[2] = { ptr, mask };
02292 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0svn)
02293                 llvm::ArrayRef<llvm::Value *> argArray(&args[0], &args[2]);
02294                 llvm::Instruction *newCall = 
02295                     llvm::CallInst::Create(gatherInfo->loadMaskedFunc, argArray, 
02296                                            "load_masked", (llvm::Instruction *)NULL);
02297 #else
02298                 llvm::Instruction *newCall = 
02299                     llvm::CallInst::Create(gatherInfo->loadMaskedFunc, &args[0],
02300                                            &args[2], "load_masked");
02301 #endif
02302                 lCopyMetadata(newCall, callInst);
02303                 llvm::ReplaceInstWithInst(callInst, newCall);
02304             }
02305             else {
02306                 Debug(pos, "Transformed scatter to unaligned vector store!");
02307                 llvm::Value *rvalue = callInst->getArgOperand(2);
02308                 ptr = new llvm::BitCastInst(ptr, scatterInfo->vecPtrType, "ptrcast", 
02309                                             callInst);
02310 
02311                 llvm::Value *args[3] = { ptr, rvalue, mask };
02312 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0svn)
02313                 llvm::ArrayRef<llvm::Value *> argArray(&args[0], &args[3]);
02314                 llvm::Instruction *newCall = 
02315                     llvm::CallInst::Create(scatterInfo->maskedStoreFunc, argArray,
02316                                            "", (llvm::Instruction *)NULL);
02317 #else
02318                 llvm::Instruction *newCall = 
02319                     llvm::CallInst::Create(scatterInfo->maskedStoreFunc,
02320                                            &args[0], &args[3], "");
02321 #endif
02322                 lCopyMetadata(newCall, callInst);
02323                 llvm::ReplaceInstWithInst(callInst, newCall);
02324             }
02325 
02326             modifiedAny = true;
02327             goto restart;
02328         }
02329 
02330 #if 0
02331         lPrintVector("scatter/gather no love: flattened", offsetElements);
02332         bb.dump();
02333 #endif
02334     }
02335 
02336     return modifiedAny;
02337 }
02338 
02339 
02340 static llvm::Pass *
02341 CreateGatherScatterImprovementsPass() {
02342     return new GSImprovementsPass;
02343 }
02344 
02345 
02346 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
02347 // LowerGSPass
02348 
02349 /** For any gathers and scatters remaining after the GSImprovementsPass
02350     runs, we need to turn them into actual native gathers and scatters.
02351     This task is handled by the LowerGSPass here.
02352  */
02353 class LowerGSPass : public llvm::BasicBlockPass {
02354 public:
02355     static char ID;
02356     LowerGSPass() : BasicBlockPass(ID) { }
02357 
02358     const char *getPassName() const { return "Gather/Scatter Improvements"; }
02359     bool runOnBasicBlock(llvm::BasicBlock &BB);
02360 };
02361 
02362 
02363 char LowerGSPass::ID = 0;
02364 
02365 llvm::RegisterPass<LowerGSPass> lgs("lower-gs",
02366                                     "Lower Gather/Scatter Pass");
02367 
02368 struct LowerGSInfo {
02369     LowerGSInfo(const char *pName, const char *aName, bool ig)
02370         : isGather(ig) {
02371         pseudoFunc = m->module->getFunction(pName);
02372         actualFunc = m->module->getFunction(aName);
02373         assert(pseudoFunc != NULL && actualFunc != NULL);
02374     }
02375     llvm::Function *pseudoFunc;
02376     llvm::Function *actualFunc;
02377     const bool isGather;
02378 };
02379 
02380 
02381 bool
02382 LowerGSPass::runOnBasicBlock(llvm::BasicBlock &bb) {
02383     LowerGSInfo lgsInfo[] = {
02384         LowerGSInfo("__pseudo_gather_base_offsets_8",  "__gather_base_offsets_i8",  true),
02385         LowerGSInfo("__pseudo_gather_base_offsets_16", "__gather_base_offsets_i16", true),
02386         LowerGSInfo("__pseudo_gather_base_offsets_32", "__gather_base_offsets_i32", true),
02387         LowerGSInfo("__pseudo_gather_base_offsets_64", "__gather_base_offsets_i64", true),
02388         LowerGSInfo("__pseudo_scatter_base_offsets_8",  "__scatter_base_offsets_i8",  false),
02389         LowerGSInfo("__pseudo_scatter_base_offsets_16", "__scatter_base_offsets_i16", false),
02390         LowerGSInfo("__pseudo_scatter_base_offsets_32", "__scatter_base_offsets_i32", false),
02391         LowerGSInfo("__pseudo_scatter_base_offsets_64", "__scatter_base_offsets_i64", false)
02392     };
02393 
02394     bool modifiedAny = false;
02395  restart:
02396     for (llvm::BasicBlock::iterator iter = bb.begin(), e = bb.end(); iter != e; ++iter) {
02397         // Loop over the instructions and find calls to the
02398         // __pseudo_*_base_offsets_* functions.
02399         llvm::CallInst *callInst = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::CallInst>(&*iter);
02400         if (callInst == NULL)
02401             continue;
02402         llvm::Function *calledFunc = callInst->getCalledFunction();
02403         LowerGSInfo *info = NULL;
02404         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < sizeof(lgsInfo) / sizeof(lgsInfo[0]); ++i) {
02405             if (calledFunc == lgsInfo[i].pseudoFunc) {
02406                 info = &lgsInfo[i];
02407                 break;
02408             }
02409         }
02410         if (info == NULL)
02411             continue;
02412 
02413         // Get the source position from the metadata attached to the call
02414         // instruction so that we can issue PerformanceWarning()s below.
02415         SourcePos pos;
02416         bool ok = lGetSourcePosFromMetadata(callInst, &pos);
02417         assert(ok);     
02418 
02419         callInst->setCalledFunction(info->actualFunc);
02420         if (info->isGather)
02421             PerformanceWarning(pos, "Gather required to compute value in expression.");
02422         else
02423             PerformanceWarning(pos, "Scatter required for storing value.");
02424         modifiedAny = true;
02425         goto restart;
02426     }
02427     return modifiedAny;
02428 }
02429 
02430 
02431 static llvm::Pass *
02432 CreateLowerGatherScatterPass() {
02433     return new LowerGSPass;
02434 }
02435 
02436 
02437 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
02438 // IsCompileTimeConstantPass
02439 
02440 /** LLVM IR implementations of target-specific functions may include calls
02441     to the functions "bool __is_compile_time_constant_*(...)"; these allow
02442     them to have specialied code paths for where the corresponding value is
02443     known at compile time.  For masks, for example, this allows them to not
02444     incur the cost of a MOVMSK call at runtime to compute its value in
02445     cases where the mask value isn't known until runtime.
02446 
02447     This pass resolves these calls into either 'true' or 'false' values so
02448     that later optimization passes can operate with these as constants.
02449 
02450     See stdlib.m4 for a number of uses of this idiom. 
02451  */
02452 
02453 class IsCompileTimeConstantPass : public llvm::BasicBlockPass {
02454 public:
02455     static char ID;
02456     IsCompileTimeConstantPass(bool last = false) : BasicBlockPass(ID) {
02457         isLastTry = last;
02458     }
02459 
02460     const char *getPassName() const { return "Resolve \"is compile time constant\""; }
02461     bool runOnBasicBlock(llvm::BasicBlock &BB);
02462 
02463     bool isLastTry;
02464 };
02465 
02466 char IsCompileTimeConstantPass::ID = 0;
02467 
02468 llvm::RegisterPass<IsCompileTimeConstantPass> 
02469     ctcrp("compile-time-constant", "Compile-Time Constant Resolve Pass");
02470 
02471 bool
02472 IsCompileTimeConstantPass::runOnBasicBlock(llvm::BasicBlock &bb) {
02473     llvm::Function *funcs[] = {
02474         m->module->getFunction("__is_compile_time_constant_mask"),
02475         m->module->getFunction("__is_compile_time_constant_uniform_int32"),
02476         m->module->getFunction("__is_compile_time_constant_varying_int32")
02477     };
02478 
02479     bool modifiedAny = false;
02480  restart:
02481     for (llvm::BasicBlock::iterator i = bb.begin(), e = bb.end(); i != e; ++i) {
02482         // Iterate through the instructions looking for calls to the
02483         // __is_compile_time_constant_*() functions
02484         llvm::CallInst *callInst = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::CallInst>(&*i);
02485         if (callInst == NULL)
02486             continue;
02487 
02488         int j;
02489         int nFuncs = sizeof(funcs) / sizeof(funcs[0]);
02490         for (j = 0; j < nFuncs; ++j) {
02491             if (callInst->getCalledFunction() == funcs[j]) 
02492                 break;
02493         }
02494         if (j == nFuncs)
02495             // not a __is_compile_time_constant_* function
02496             continue;
02497 
02498         // This optimization pass can be disabled with the (poorly named)
02499         // disableGatherScatterFlattening option.
02500         if (g->opt.disableGatherScatterFlattening) {
02501             llvm::ReplaceInstWithValue(i->getParent()->getInstList(), i, LLVMFalse);
02502             modifiedAny = true;
02503             goto restart;
02504         }
02505 
02506         // Is it a constant?  Bingo, turn the call's value into a constant
02507         // true value.
02508         llvm::Value *operand = callInst->getArgOperand(0);
02509         if (llvm::isa<llvm::Constant>(operand)) {
02510             llvm::ReplaceInstWithValue(i->getParent()->getInstList(), i, LLVMTrue);
02511             modifiedAny = true;
02512             goto restart;
02513         }
02514 
02515         // This pass runs multiple times during optimization.  Up until the
02516         // very last time, it only replaces the call with a 'true' if the
02517         // value is known to be constant and otherwise leaves the call
02518         // alone, in case further optimization passes can help resolve its
02519         // value.  The last time through, it eventually has to give up, and
02520         // replaces any remaining ones with 'false' constants.
02521         if (isLastTry) {
02522             llvm::ReplaceInstWithValue(i->getParent()->getInstList(), i, LLVMFalse);
02523             modifiedAny = true;
02524             goto restart;
02525         }
02526     }
02527 
02528     return modifiedAny;
02529 }
02530 
02531 
02532 static llvm::Pass *
02533 CreateIsCompileTimeConstantPass(bool isLastTry) {
02534     return new IsCompileTimeConstantPass(isLastTry);
02535 }
02536 
02537 
02538 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
02539 // MakeInternalFuncsStaticPass
02540 
02541 /** There are a number of target-specific functions that we use during
02542     these optimization passes.  By the time we are done with optimization,
02543     any uses of these should be inlined and no calls to these functions
02544     should remain.  This pass marks all of these functions as having
02545     private linkage so that subsequent passes can eliminate them as dead
02546     code, thus cleaning up the final code output by the compiler.  We can't
02547     just declare these as static from the start, however, since then they
02548     end up being eliminated as dead code during early optimization passes
02549     even though we may need to generate calls to them during later
02550     optimization passes.
02551  */
02552 class MakeInternalFuncsStaticPass : public llvm::ModulePass {
02553 public:
02554     static char ID;
02555     MakeInternalFuncsStaticPass(bool last = false) : ModulePass(ID) {
02556     }
02557 
02558     const char *getPassName() const { return "Make internal funcs \"static\""; }
02559     bool runOnModule(llvm::Module &m);
02560 };
02561 
02562 char MakeInternalFuncsStaticPass::ID = 0;
02563 
02564 llvm::RegisterPass<MakeInternalFuncsStaticPass> 
02565   mifsp("make-internal-funcs-static", "Make Internal Funcs Static Pass");
02566 
02567 
02568 bool
02569 MakeInternalFuncsStaticPass::runOnModule(llvm::Module &module) {
02570     const char *names[] = {
02571         "__do_print", "__fast_masked_vload",
02572         "__gather_base_offsets_i8", "__gather_base_offsets_i16",
02573         "__gather_base_offsets_i32", "__gather_base_offsets_i64",
02574         "__gather_elt_8", "__gather_elt_16", 
02575         "__gather_elt_32", "__gather_elt_64", 
02576         "__load_and_broadcast_8", "__load_and_broadcast_16",
02577         "__load_and_broadcast_32", "__load_and_broadcast_64",
02578         "__load_masked_8", "__load_masked_16",
02579         "__load_masked_32", "__load_masked_64",
02580         "__masked_store_8", "__masked_store_16",
02581         "__masked_store_32", "__masked_store_64",
02582         "__masked_store_blend_8", "__masked_store_blend_16",
02583         "__masked_store_blend_32", "__masked_store_blend_64",
02584         "__packed_load_active", "__packed_store_active",
02585         "__scatter_base_offsets_i8", "__scatter_base_offsets_i16",
02586         "__scatter_base_offsets_i32", "__scatter_base_offsets_i64",
02587         "__scatter_elt_8", "__scatter_elt_16", 
02588         "__scatter_elt_32", "__scatter_elt_64", 
02589     };
02590 
02591     bool modifiedAny = false;
02592     int count = sizeof(names) / sizeof(names[0]);
02593     for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i) {
02594         llvm::Function *f = m->module->getFunction(names[i]);
02595         if (f != NULL) {
02596             f->setLinkage(llvm::GlobalValue::PrivateLinkage);
02597             modifiedAny = true;
02598         }
02599     }
02600 
02601     return modifiedAny;
02602 }
02603 
02604 
02605 static llvm::Pass *
02606 CreateMakeInternalFuncsStaticPass() {
02607     return new MakeInternalFuncsStaticPass;
02608 }
